I think you are correct, there are actually 2 other files in that directory with the same name and timestamps (different extensions). Any idea what the workflow was to get those all in there (i.e. which one is the source, and how are the others generated).'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-07-18 21:05:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi guys - SVG is the source, and PNG is output from any editor that can read SVG and export PNG, such as Gimp or Inkscape or OmniGraffle or... probably there's an online editor to. I can do it if you don't have a tool, just let me know."}, {'account_id': 1627, 'date': '2012-07-19 07:44:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve; Approved

* Fixes bug 1028684
* Adds metadata and other parameters to volume create

commit_message:
Adds xcp disk resize support.

Implements resize image during instance creation.  Fixes bug 1016650.

Change-Id: I25f9d1030d9d014b1c9a65430bd535388b8f8943

commit_message:
Use compute_driver in xenapi driver help messages.

Updates the help messages in the xenapi driver to use 'compute_driver'
examples instead of 'connection_type' which is now deprecated.

Change-Id: I79b050f0b083533e60129da261326cfb7f304321

commit_message:
Xen: Ensure snapshot is torn down on error.

This patch solves the problem of snapshots being left around if an
exception is generated in _wait_for_vhd_coalesce.

The solution is to separate snapshot from coalesce and then to ensure
any exceptions generated after a snapshot trigger a cleanup.

Change-Id: I4c03243bc41f76d80d32934dd9506d1861951184

[{'created': '2012-07-24 04:45:28.000000000', 'message': 'Check for exception codes in openstack API results

 * openstack api was defaulting to code 500 for all non Nova exceptions
 * Check any exception for an error code and use it in parser
 * This addresses tempest failures when using Cinder volume service

Change-Id: If49e364063d5288c81ce1557bddc6dcec3ec457e
'}, {'created': '2012-07-24 15:46:38.000000000', 'message': 'Check for exception codes in openstack API results

 * openstack api was defaulting to code 500 for all non Nova exceptions
 * refactor _err method to process any exception
 * remove special case handling of non-nova exceptions
 * modify unit tests to handle messages
 * This addresses tempest failures when using Cinder volume service

Change-Id: If49e364063d5288c81ce1557bddc6dcec3ec457e
'}, {'created': '2012-07-24 16:09:43.000000000', 'message': 'Check for exception codes in openstack API results

 * openstack api was defaulting to code 500 for all non Nova exceptions
 * refactor _err method to process any exception
 * remove special case handling of non-nova exceptions
 * modify unit tests to handle messages
 * This addresses tempest failures when using Cinder volume service

Change-Id: If49e364063d5288c81ce1557bddc6dcec3ec457e
'}, {'created': '2012-07-25 15:16:49.000000000', 'message': "Check for exception codes in openstack API results

 * Inspect all exceptions for code, not just nova.exceptions

   Originally the fault wrapper would only inspect an exception for
   status, header and safe attributes if it was a nova.exception.

   As a result, excecptions returned from Cinder were always being incorrectly
   interpretted/categorized as ComputeFaults (500).  This results in tempest
   tests that expect exceptions such as 404 NotFound to fail.

   Now that we're checking all Exceptions the same way, there's no need
   for a specifying nova.exceptions or even doing the import.

Change-Id: If49e364063d5288c81ce1557bddc6dcec3ec457e
"}]
commit_message:
Check for exception codes in openstack API results

 * Inspect all exceptions for code, not just nova.exceptions

   Originally the fault wrapper would only inspect an exception for
   status, header and safe attributes if it was a nova.exception.

   As a result, excecptions returned from Cinder were always being incorrectly
   interpretted/categorized as ComputeFaults (500).  This results in tempest
   tests that expect exceptions such as 404 NotFound to fail.

   Now that we're checking all Exceptions the same way, there's no need
   for a specifying nova.exceptions or even doing the import.

Change-Id: If49e364063d5288c81ce1557bddc6dcec3ec457e

commit_message:
Implements memory counter

This adds a memory counter, that is emitted at the same time than instance
counter. It is the first counter implementing the 'absolute' counter type.

Change-Id: I3bfd57da61029d43ba4f731f98dc58f790f9f8cd
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>

commit_message:
Adds multi tenant support for swift backend.

Updates the swift store to support multiple tenants:

 * Added configuration option for swift_store_multi_tenant.

 * Updated the swift connection creation logic so that in multi-tenant
   mode the token and storage URL from the service catalog are used
   to create swift connection.

 * When in multi-tenant mode locations URL's (stored in the DB) do
   not contain hard coded swift credentials.

Includes unit tests to verify multi-tenant swift storage URLs.

Partially implements blueprint: swift-tenant-specific-storage.

Change-Id: I45fc97027e6f211ac353513c2d9d6da51ccf4489

[{'created': '2012-07-25 13:34:52.000000000', 'message': "Make a template that demonstrates instance monitoring and restarting.

We use cfn-push-stats to send a heartbeat and if we don't get
it within the set interval we restart the instance.

Other changes to make this work:
- clear the waitcondition when it is deleted.
- set the resource id to None when deleted, else it won't re-create
  properly.
- don't run watch alarms if the stack is not completed.

Change-Id: I5dfc8b372f557cf43379c6c5b7436d1010f83e3c
Signed-off-by: Angus Salkeld <asalkeld@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Make a template that demonstrates instance monitoring and restarting.

We use cfn-push-stats to send a heartbeat and if we don't get
it within the set interval we restart the instance.

Other changes to make this work:
- clear the waitcondition when it is deleted.
- set the resource id to None when deleted, else it won't re-create
  properly.
- don't run watch alarms if the stack is not completed.

Change-Id: I5dfc8b372f557cf43379c6c5b7436d1010f83e3c
Signed-off-by: Angus Salkeld <asalkeld@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Call calulate_properties() before calling FnGetAtt()

The problem is that in the delete the order of resolution is reversed
so in delete loop we have not yet done a calulate_properties() on the
resource that we are about to call FnGetAtt() for.

Fixes #178
Signed-off-by: Angus Salkeld <asalkeld@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I8af6f8a78086a7b1f2bcc280d57af0b4311f08cc

Routes are added and removed from exabgp's configuration on floating IP association and disassociation, and on network-node initialization.

commit_message:
Add support for advertising floating IPs via BGP

This change implements blueprint advertise-floating-ip-via-bgp. It has a dependency on exabgp. exabgp must be patched to daemonize properly (http://code.google.com/p/exabgp/issues/detail?id=4). This change runs and manages an exabgp process and configuration. Routes are added and removed from exabgp's configuration on floating IP association and disassociation, and on network-node initialization.

Five new flags are added:

  * use_bgp: enables bgp support
  * bgp_peer_addresses: the router addresses this node is peering with
  * bgp_local_as: the local Autonomous System (AS)
  * bgp_peer_as: the peer's Autonomous System (AS)
  * exabgp_location: the exabgp binary's location

Change-Id: I8160268e44e2afc736bf8491d5cbf5af1f4f752f

I'm not sold we need this, or that it should be a part of Glance. Maybe you should push this into openstack-common rather than copying it around between all the projects?

I also question how useful adding an arbitrary endpoint that prints OK really is. Why not build in some sort of system status page to an admin api that can give you more than just 'OK' (when things may not really be ok!) ?"}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-07-16 23:22:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I agree.  Seems kind of silly... when you can do a GET / and look for a response.  An "OK" doesn't tell me anything more useful.  In fact, it seems less useful.  Correct me if I'm wrong...  Maybe I'm missing something.'}, {'account_id': 1390, 'date': '2012-07-17 10:36:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Thanks for the input Brian/Chris.  

I agree, this should likely be a part of openstack-common.  The main reason I didn't go for that approach right away was there doesn't (currently) seem to be a mechanism for copying over config file changes (e.g. pipeline/filter) along with modules in common.  

A system status page is also a good idea, will have a think if there's something that could be done here."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-07-25 06:03:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-07-25 06:03:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2012-07-12 15:38:45.000000000', 'message': 'Port the swift healthcheck middleware to Glance

Can be used as a first port of call to determine if a Glance API /
Registry server is running properly.

The main part of this code is taken directly from Swift.

Notes / additions:

* Added the healthcheck to each of the default pipelines in
  glance-api-paste.ini / glance-registry-paste.ini.

* Updated tests.unit.test_config to account for the updated default
  configuration.

* Updated references to the default pipeline in the documentation to refer to
  the new default.

* Added a section to doc/source/glanceapi.rst to describe the new
  functionality.

* Added a new module glance.common.middleware to house the healthcheck,
  as this middleware is common to both the Glance API and Registry.

* Added a new functional test for the healthcheck not currently present
  in Swift, which tests the middleware in the pipeline through a running
  Glance API and Registry server.

Implements blueprint port-swift-healthcheck.

Change-Id: I406b5820c4a09658b012d9681d2faa938d81baac

  as this middleware is common to both the Glance API and Registry.

* Added a new functional test for the healthcheck not currently present
  in Swift, which tests the middleware in the pipeline through a running
  Glance API and Registry server.

Implements blueprint port-swift-healthcheck.

Change-Id: I406b5820c4a09658b012d9681d2faa938d81baac
'}]
commit_message:
Port the swift healthcheck middleware to Glance

Can be used as a first port of call to determine if a Glance API /
Registry server is running properly.

The main part of this code is taken directly from Swift.

Notes / additions:

* Added the healthcheck to each of the default pipelines in
  glance-api-paste.ini / glance-registry-paste.ini.

* Updated tests.unit.test_config to account for the updated default
  configuration.

* Updated references to the default pipeline in the documentation to refer to
  the new default.

* Added a section to doc/source/glanceapi.rst to describe the new
  functionality.

* Added a new module glance.common.middleware to house the healthcheck,
  as this middleware is common to both the Glance API and Registry.

* Added a new functional test for the healthcheck not currently present
  in Swift, which tests the middleware in the pipeline through a running
  Glance API and Registry server.

Implements blueprint port-swift-healthcheck.

Change-Id: I406b5820c4a09658b012d9681d2faa938d81baac

commit_message:
Move 'name' to 'display_name' in hypervisor-servers call

To be consistent with naming, display the same name that
novaclient uses. Also, fixed issue where there are no
instances on a hypervisor to return an empty list.

Change-Id: I63aea98de15faa2f7784e44aa6bf5fd3b89517c3

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-07-25 06:03:04.000000000', 'message': "Fix ZeroMQ driver and tests

Fixes a number of bugs:

Adds test-options, taken from Nova.

zmq tests skipped on python 2.6 until we can pass reliably.

test_zmq listens only on 127.0.0.1

Configures RPC timeout in impl_zmq since no longer in fake_flags.

Restructures test_zmq's daemon launching/testing to be more robust.

Restores unit tests of zmq

Add pyzmq to test-options

Fix super RpcZmqBaseTestCase in test_zmq; bug 1021451

Remove opt registration from test_zmq; Related to bug 1021459

Fix zeromq options; Fixes bug 1021462 and bug 1021459.

Call our own register_opts
Brackets should be Parens in str formatting.
fixes bug 1021455.

Fix super RpcZmqBaseTestCase in test_zmq; Fixes bug 1021451

Change-Id: I6234c709346fadd6c9d9e736a51955c5efeb3ec6

commit_message:
Fix ZeroMQ driver and tests

Fixes a number of bugs:

Better detection of zmq libraries in tests.

Adds test-options, taken from Nova.

Fixes breakage in flags introduced by 372d11e990...

zmq tests skipped on python 2.6 until we can pass reliably.

test_zmq listens only on 127.0.0.1

Configures RPC timeout in impl_zmq since no longer in fake_flags.

Restructures test_zmq's daemon launching/testing to be more robust.

Restores unit tests of zmq

Add pyzmq to test-options

Fix super RpcZmqBaseTestCase in test_zmq; bug 1021451

Remove opt registration from test_zmq; Related to bug 1021459

Fix zeromq options; Fixes bug 1021462 and bug 1021459.

Call our own register_opts
Brackets should be Parens in str formatting.
fixes bug 1021455.

Fix super RpcZmqBaseTestCase in test_zmq; Fixes bug 1021451

Change-Id: I6234c709346fadd6c9d9e736a51955c5efeb3ec6

    A toggle to indicate if the table accepte two or more typs of data.

    A list of data types that this table would accept. Default to be an

commit_message:
Makes data table accept mixed data types

This is the first step of making the resource browser, related to
blueprint swift-ui-improvements.

Adds three attrs to DataTableOptions:
.. attribute:: mixed_data_type

.. attribute:: data_types

.. attribute:: data_type_name

Adds attr to Column class:
.. attribute:: allowed_data_types

Adds attr to Action and LinkAction class:
.. attribute:: allowed_data_types

Changes implentation of FilterAction.
Adds MixedDataTableView.

Change-Id: I45fce5e889e92abc592f0a5abfef1abb4ce527be

[{'created': '2012-07-24 23:41:33.000000000', 'message': 'Fix checks in server listing only lok for an ID

The list server filter details checks were checking
entire mappings against the list of mappings returned
from a call to GET /servers/detail. Unfortunately, the
mappings returned by the GET /servers/detail and the
mapping returned by POST /servers are slightly different,
resulting in the comparison failing. We really only are
checking that the server instance we expect to be in the
returned list of instances is there, so checking for the
server ID in the returned list is fine.

Change-Id: If9680f56a1ea06ffe93393d06b23bd231ccddd01
Fixes: LP Bug 1028465pep8 build for tempest.
'}]
commit_message:
Fix checks in server listing only lok for an ID

The list server filter details checks were checking
entire mappings against the list of mappings returned
from a call to GET /servers/detail. Unfortunately, the
mappings returned by the GET /servers/detail and the
mapping returned by POST /servers are slightly different,
resulting in the comparison failing. We really only are
checking that the server instance we expect to be in the
returned list of instances is there, so checking for the
server ID in the returned list is fine.

Change-Id: If9680f56a1ea06ffe93393d06b23bd231ccddd01
Fixes: LP Bug 1028465pep8 build for tempest.

commit_message:
Ensure checks in server listing only lok for an ID

The list server filter details checks were checking
entire mappings against the list of mappings returned
from a call to GET /servers/detail. Unfortunately, the
mappings returned by the GET /servers/detail and the
mapping returned by POST /servers are slightly different,
resulting in the comparison failing. We really only are
checking that the server instance we expect to be in the
returned list of instances is there, so checking for the
server ID in the returned list is fine.

This includes the tox fixes since the gate cannot be fixed
without both...

Change-Id: I0195e7f49a7c2bb217f61368ea829f2356733c8d
Fixes: LP Bug 1028465

Not sure if we want to do that, openstack-common should be pep8'd so if we run into anything, we should fix that in openstack-common. Just a thought."}, {'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2012-07-24 04:51:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

I'm ok with this actually.  The openstack-common project should gate things appropriately on their checkin.  The code in Cinder should have already been checked/passed via the common projects process.

The one advantage to this is we're not linked to common's pep 8 version if/when it changes.  I can be swayed, but initial thought is to de-couple them."}, {'account_id': 2759, 'date': '2012-07-24 05:25:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Nirmal, I agree that bug report/fix should go to openstack-common. My concern is when PEP8 issue happened, it will cause every jenkins job fail and it takes (relatively) long time to get fixed (depends on how fast openstack-common can merge the fix). That's why I'd like to exclude openstack-common in Cinder's PEP8 checking."}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2012-07-24 08:43:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Pep8 test reports issue on openstack-common modules, which would
fail CI test. Pep8 test should skip openstack-common and assuming
they are problem-free code. Even it's not, bug/fix should go to
openstack-common first, then resync back to Cinder.  Therefore,
Cinder should skip pep8 test for openstack-common code.

Fix bug #1027774

Change-Id: I22c45542401022a6bad9f2320e8657f972915f69
"}]
commit_message:
Don't do PEP8 test for openstack-common code.

Pep8 test reports issue on openstack-common modules, which would
fail CI test. Pep8 test should skip openstack-common and assuming
they are problem-free code. Even it's not, bug/fix should go to
openstack-common first, then resync back to Cinder.  Therefore,
Cinder should skip pep8 test for openstack-common code.

Fix bug #1027774

Change-Id: I22c45542401022a6bad9f2320e8657f972915f69

commit_message:
Add image_name to create and rebuild notifications

Fixes bug 1027197

Without image_name in notifications, one has to use the image_ref
and hit glance again.
The create and rebuild functions already contain image_metadata, hence
adding the image_name in their notification can prevent additional
call to glance.

Change-Id: I3813eafa24b125575bcdceac8d30ab6bd909cfe4

'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2012-07-24 21:45:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (5 inline comments)

This might seem odd, but I agree with both Yong and Bob points. 
The difficulty with this blueprint is that, in my opinion, the extension framework currently available in Quantum does not play well with the v2 API, and also does not provide a mechanism for extending resources (however it seems that this 'comes for free' as currently the v2 API does not complain when unknown attributes are passed onto the request body - a think which honestly I don't know if is "by design").

As far as functionality and style are concerned, this patchset looks good to me. The only thing that should probably be added are unit tests in the plugin directories, as we don't want the coverage of source code tree to go down!

Summarizing, we should probably consider one of the two following ways forward:
1) put this patch on hold, sort out the extension framework fro v2, and then go back to this patch
2) approve this patch, file a blueprint for getting the extension framework upadated to api v2 targeting folsom-3, and then adapt the provider-networks code to the improved extensions framework.

thoughts?'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2012-07-24 21:45:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (4 inline comments)

Bob,

more replies inline.

As a general note, the approach #3 you suggest is kind of a "natural alternative" to approach #2 and should definitely be considered. I still seriously hope to have an extension framework for F-3.

I am not sure whether the provider Vlan id is a good candidate for the core api, as it kind of violates quantum's "technology agnostic" tenet - however this would definitely solve our problem altogether.

On the other work items related to this, I have already taken the public networks blueprint, and I hope I will be able to share the blueprint draft with the community by the end of the day.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-07-24 21:45:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (7 inline comments)

Hi,
I ran into difficulties trying to test this. Are there plans to add v2 client support for this?
Thanks
Gary'}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2012-07-24 21:45:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: (7 inline comments)

See my responses to the in-line comments. I will be pushing a new patch set shortly with the mentioned improvements. The overall issue regarding support for extended attributes will be addressed afterwards via https://bugs.launchpad.net/quantum/+bug/1023111. 

Salvatore has suggested adding openvswitch unit tests. I agree these are needed, but I'd like to defer that until after the in-memory VlanMap is replaced with DB transactions as described in https://bugs.launchpad.net/quantum/+bug/1023167."}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2012-07-24 21:45:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (7 inline comments)

The current V2 client supports extended attributes out-of-the-box. As long as you have the admin role, you should see the provider:vlan_id in all returned network dictionaries, and you should be able to pass "--provider:vlan_id <vlan_id>" at the end of the net-create command line. Please let me know if this isn't working. If you don't have the admin role, then you won't see the provider attributes, and trying to specify provider:vlan_id will result in an authorization error.

I've replied to all of Gary's inline comments. The only code change so far is to add the legal range to the text in the InvalidInput exception for both plugins, so I'm not pushing a new patch set quite yet. 

I'd like to hear from Gary and others on whether allowing update of provider attributes (vlan_id now, physical network and maybe type later) is useful and practical. I could easily be convinced to allow this in router.py, and then have the existing plugins raise an exception as long as their agents don't support changing these details on the fly.'}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2012-07-24 21:45:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

Hi Yong,

I appreciate your comment about this not being like other extensions. 

From the client's perspective, I believe this is a proper extension - it extends the core API with additional capabilities, and metadata about the extension's availability and version is available as the v2.0/extensions/provider resource. Some plugins will implement the extension, while others might not. 

But from the plugin's perspective, I guess you could characterize it as being "intrusive". The functionality it provides modifies the existing core behaviour, so its not something that can be added externally, or even "mixed in" with the plugin implementation. The 2nd phase of this BP will have significantly more impact on the plugins - adding support for flat networks and multiple network interfaces. These capabilities are required for certain use cases, and for nova parity, and may be usable for non-provider (aka dynamic or virtual) networks as well as for provider networks.

I guess it could be argued that the provider network API extensions could or should become part of the core API. I think that would alleviate your concerns about them being "intrusive" to the plugins. But it can also be argued that not all networking technologies supported by plugins will be able to support provider VLANs or provider flat networks, so it can be argued that this functionality belongs in an API extension. I'd be happy with this either in the core API or as an API extension. I think it makes most sense for Folsom to stick with the extension approach, and then we could revisit whether it belongs in the core API after we have more experience with it.'}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2012-07-24 21:45:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2012-07-24 21:45:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Hi again Yong,

After looking over your comment and my reply once again, I'd appreciate if you could clarify what you think needs to be done differently in this extension implementation.

I believe there are two aspects of the "extension framework" that could be significantly improved to better support this sort of extension: 

1) There should be a way for extensions to register information about their extended attributes so that the router.py and views.py core files do not need to be modified. 

2) The QuantumDbPluginV2 base class should provide an "event handler" mechanism by which derived plugins can implement their extended attributes and maybe a mechanism for them to extend the DB models with additional fields. This would allow field selection and filtering for the extended attributes to be handled by the base class along with the core attributes.

Do you feel that one or both of these need to be addressed immediately before this functionality can be merged? Or is there some other aspect of the "extension framework" that needs to be addressed now? Can we live with the current approach for now, and enhance the support for this sort of extension in the future? Or should we make the provider attributes part of the core API now, and have plugins that do not support VLANs raise exceptions if provider VLANs are requested?

-Bob'}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2012-07-24 21:45:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: (4 inline comments)

Thanks Salvatore! I will push an updated patch set later today with some added comments and improved unit tests, and Gary's suggested exception improvements.

I'm also not sure if the current silent pass-through of extended attributes in request bodies is by design or not. It worked the same way with V1.x. Listing the request attributes in RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTE_MAP takes advantage of the API code's checking, but does not effect the attribute being passed-through, at least for JSON. But adding the attribute to the keys tuple in views.py does seem to be necessary for the attribute to be included in the response messages.

I think there are two additional possible ways forward:

3) Like #2, but update the extension framework in the G release rather than F-3. I'd argue that the improvements to the extension framework should not be rushed (we should look at other projects, etc.), and deserve a session at the design summit.

4) Decide that the provider attributes belong in the core V2 (admin) API rather than in an extension.

My concern is that I still have significant work to do for phase 2 of this BP, adding support for flat networks and multiple interfaces. These are needed for Nova networking parity, as well as for provider use cases. I believe that option #1 would risk not getting this BP done for F-3. 

If hooks to register extended attributes would be sufficient and could be added without major disruption/re-design of the existing extension framework, or if someone else could take on improving the extension framework right away, then I'd favor option #2. Otherwise I think options #3 or #4 are the only ones that are realistic given the time constrains."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-07-24 21:45:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

Build successful

Hi Bob,
thanks for updating your patch, and apologies for a long delay for this review.

I have some concerns which hopefully you can help me with:
- the behaviour for non-admin users is not what I was expecting, as I would have expected a 422 or a 403 to be returned
- I am not sure whether we want to have policy checks in the plugins. I tend to see plugin are something which are orthogonal to authz (I am adopting a different approach in my public networks branch - as you are working on a similar problem your feedback would be appreciated)
- Is there any way to turn the extension off if you don't want to use it?"}, {'account_id': 490, 'date': '2012-07-24 21:45:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Thanks Bob for this patch. I tend to agree with Salvatore about not having to do the policy checks inside each plugin (I believe you are in agreement as well). Having said that, I do not have any specific solutions, but will think over this. Since this patch has gone through a lot of reviews, we should probably push it in if everyone is reasonably happy.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-07-24 21:45:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Thanks for addressing the comments.
Gary'}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2012-07-24 21:45:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Sumit,

Thank you very much for reviewing this patch set. This patch set is currently a WIP, waiting for https://review.openstack.org/#/c/9849/ to be approved so that extended attribute details will no longer need to be built into the core. It would be really helpful if you would review that patch, and then I'll update this to use that extension mechanism.

-Bob"}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2012-07-24 21:45:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Work In Progress'}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2012-07-24 21:45:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2012-07-24 21:45:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: (5 inline comments)

I've responded in-line to most of the comments. Regarding these:

(Salvatore) the behaviour for non-admin users is not what I was expecting, as I would have expected a 422 or a 403 to be returned

My intent is that a proper not-authorized/forbidden error code (403?) should be returned when attempting to set a provider attribute if not authorized. I seem to be getting 500, so will check into this.

But my intent is that failing the "view" authorization checks should simply result in the provider attributes not being returned, not in an error.

(Salvatore)    I am not sure whether we want to have policy checks in the plugins. I tend to see plugin are something which are orthogonal to authz (I am adopting a different approach in my public networks branch - as you are working on a similar problem your feedback would be appreciated)

I agree having policy checks in the plugins is not ideal. I could adopt the fine grained approach that you are using for setting the provider attributes, but I don't think that would allow distingishing between setting them and viewing them (which I now think is necessary - see the in-line comment repsonse).

One idea would be to use the resource attribute map to drive the policy checking. I'm thinking maybe the is_visible attribute property being added in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/9849/ could name a policy to check to determine whether that attribute is visible. We could also add attribute properties for set authorization, or use your fine-grained approach for setting (on just create & update) combined with the attribute property approach for viewing. Thoughts?

(Salvatore)    Is there any way to turn the extension off if you don't want to use it?

I guess the policy could be used for this. Is that sufficient? Or should the plugins have an enable_provider_networking configuration boolean?'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-07-24 21:45:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Works for me

I believe phase 1 should now be ready to merge. 

After discussing Salvatore's plans for core support for attribute authorization, it sounds like his mechanism may be able to meet the provider extension's needs. But since that mechanism is not yet available, the provider attribute authorization checks remain in the plugins for now. This can be revisited in phase 2.

Hi,
In my point of view, to implement the bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/quantum/+bug/1023111 will look like more 'Initial V2 implementation of provider extension'. We need a framework to implement the extension and place a good foundation for later new extension. Ask myself, if I need add another extension, what I should do?

Sorry if I miss the point.

Yong Sheng Gong"}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2012-07-24 21:45:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (1 inline comment)

commit_message:
Initial V2 implementation of provider extension.

Initial provider extension implementation. Specify vlan_id using the
CLI with admin rights via "net-create --tenant_id <tenant-id>
<net-name> --provider:vlan_id <vlan-id>". Also includes
provider:vlan_id in reply messages for admins. The extension is
supported in the linuxbridge and openvswitch plugins.

Partially implements blueprint provider-networks.

Change-Id: I2fff64c4247b1a3091c28c7a2cd632afda192c3d

[{'created': '2012-07-24 21:00:44.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure checks in server listing only lok for an ID

The list server filter details checks were checking
entire mappings against the list of mappings returned
from a call to GET /servers/detail. Unfortunately, the
mappings returned by the GET /servers/detail and the
mapping returned by POST /servers are slightly different,
resulting in the comparison failing. We really only are
checking that the server instance we expect to be in the
returned list of instances is there, so checking for the
server ID in the returned list is fine.

Change-Id: Icacddc386062d25a12006d3cf6491f72ea33e3cf
Fixes: LP Bug 1028465
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure checks in server listing only lok for an ID

The list server filter details checks were checking
entire mappings against the list of mappings returned
from a call to GET /servers/detail. Unfortunately, the
mappings returned by the GET /servers/detail and the
mapping returned by POST /servers are slightly different,
resulting in the comparison failing. We really only are
checking that the server instance we expect to be in the
returned list of instances is there, so checking for the
server ID in the returned list is fine.

Change-Id: Icacddc386062d25a12006d3cf6491f72ea33e3cf
Fixes: LP Bug 1028465

Ok, a broken API is pretty bad. The fix looks safe enough, isolated to the broken API and is already on master.

My one question was whether the old code ever worked and, if it did, when it stopped working? From the master review, it sounds like it's minor mystery.

Thanks for the backport Adam. A couple of things for future reference - you should do 'git cherry-pick -x' so that the backport includes the same Change-Id and also the commit ID on master. There's no need to say "this is a backport" in the commit message since petty much all stable branch commits are backports.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-07-24 20:11:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified

[{'created': '2012-07-23 20:20:45.000000000', 'message': 'Backport fix for API listing of os-hosts.

Backports fix for bug 1014925 to stable/essex, which resolves issue
where querying /v1.1/$tenant/os-hosts returns an empty list.

Original fix by Joe Gordon reviewed into Folsom at:

    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/8682/2

Change-Id: I44ac2e519b7af9b8f3b37a42280ac6fe71c31a1c
'}]
commit_message:
Backport fix for API listing of os-hosts.

Backports fix for bug 1014925 to stable/essex, which resolves issue
where querying /v1.1/$tenant/os-hosts returns an empty list.

Original fix by Joe Gordon reviewed into Folsom at:

    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/8682/2

Change-Id: I44ac2e519b7af9b8f3b37a42280ac6fe71c31a1c

commit_message:
Backport tox settings to unbreak jenkins jobs.

The stable/essex tox config for nova does not currently match the
testing standards that jenkins expects. This backports in current
changes so that jenkins coverage jobs should start passing for
stable/essex.

Change-Id: I0fd476c38d9aea7d1c60cb959d8c7ac30e515d77

[{'created': '2012-07-12 12:18:50.000000000', 'message': 'Conditionally allow queries for deleted flavours

This is four commits from upstream squashed into one:

   31506c0 Permit deleted instance types to be queried for active
           instances. (By Josh Kearney)
   f6e62c6 API users should not see deleted flavors. (By Dan Prince)
   16d26af Revert "API users should not see deleted flavors." (By Josh
           Kearney)
   5157401 Do not always query deleted instance_types. (By Brian Lamar)

It may seem strange to include both the change and the reversion of the
change, but a) this is the most accurate way to reflect the history of
the changes and b) the reversion actually includes new tests.

Change-Id: Id231e9518ac176e29cc6241fff81705910dc9e9e

   f6e62c6 API users should not see deleted flavors. (By Dan Prince)
   16d26af Revert "API users should not see deleted flavors." (By Josh

commit_message:
Conditionally allow queries for deleted flavours

Fixes bug #994935

This is four commits from upstream squashed into one:

   31506c0 Permit deleted instance types to be queried for active
           instances. (By Josh Kearney)
   f6e62c6 API users should not see deleted flavors. (By Dan Prince)
   16d26af Revert "API users should not see deleted flavors." (By Josh
           Kearney)
   5157401 Do not always query deleted instance_types. (By Brian Lamar)

It may seem strange to include both the change and the reversion of the
change, but a) this is the most accurate way to reflect the history of
the changes and b) the reversion actually includes new tests.

Change-Id: Id231e9518ac176e29cc6241fff81705910dc9e9e

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-07-14 11:54:38.000000000', 'message': "Added action for creating a volume from snapshot

Added a new action to create new volume from
a volume snapshot. The snapshot_id is passed to
nova volume API. The 'Create Volume' form is
reused, with the 'size' value being checked against
the snapshot size, as it cannot be less than
the snapshot size.

It's probably worth adding a dropdown in 'Create Volume'
in Volumes table, to list available vol snapshots there?

Fixes bug/1023740

Change-Id: I20dd8d698f5d8481938417557e09dcdc9b891e82

nova volume API. The 'Create Volume' form is
reused, with the 'size' value being checked against
the snapshot size, as it cannot be less than
the snapshot size.

Fixes bug 1023740

PATCH SET 4: Added dropdown to select snapshot source
in 'Create Volume' form, when loaded from /nova/volumes/
When a snapshot is selected from the dropdown, the name
and size are pre-filled in the form (I've removed
the description copy as it is probably specific
for the reason a snapshot is being created).

PATCH SET 6: rebased with master, fixed a bug with
get_context in nova/volume/views

Change-Id: I20dd8d698f5d8481938417557e09dcdc9b891e82
"}]
commit_message:
Added action for creating a volume from snapshot

Added a new action to create new volume from
a volume snapshot. The snapshot_id is passed to
nova volume API. The 'Create Volume' form is
reused, with the 'size' value being checked against
the snapshot size, as it cannot be less than
the snapshot size.

Fixes bug 1023740

PATCH SET 4: Added dropdown to select snapshot source
in 'Create Volume' form, when loaded from /nova/volumes/
When a snapshot is selected from the dropdown, the name
and size are pre-filled in the form (I've removed
the description copy as it is probably specific
for the reason a snapshot is being created).

PATCH SET 6: rebased with master, fixed a bug with
get_context in nova/volume/views

Change-Id: I20dd8d698f5d8481938417557e09dcdc9b891e82

commit_message:
Fixed the bug with images returned as generator

After a fix in Glance to support pagination,
the list of images is returned as generator,
while api.glance expects a list.

PATCHSET 2: removed optional kwargs if None
PATCHSET 3: fixed snapshot_list_detailed.

Fixed bug 1027210

Change-Id: I1c68e3625c22e591776e83c742e7b94dc893f196

commit_message:
Implementation of LDAP functions

implementations of delete_tenant, delete_user,
  remove_role_from_user_and_tenant, get_tenant_users
  role.delete_user and remove_role_from_user_and_tenant
  remove_user_from_tenant, change_ role

clean up LDAP sample data for live LDAP

properly check for existance of tenant_id in user.

Some tests expected the functions to be unimplemented.  Those hid the
failuers on the LDAP Identity provider and have been removed.

Make live tests extend the standard LDAP tests, so they test the same features.

Bug 1021315

Change-Id: I2866ff40fdc13040ba10d189ea2d95440eb4395c

The metadata service in nova-api needs access to
ip[6]tables-{save-restore} to accept connections to the
metadata service. This change adds an api-metadata.filters file
that needs to be deployed on setups running nova-api-metadata
or nova-api with "metadata" in enabled_apis.

Fixes bug 1002111.

Change-Id: I5aecb223876e12550394f31dbc7df893868baa8b
'}]
commit_message:
Provide rootwrap filters for nova-api-metadata

The metadata service in nova-api needs access to
ip[6]tables-{save-restore} to accept connections to the
metadata service. This change adds an api-metadata.filters file
that needs to be deployed on setups running nova-api-metadata
or nova-api with "metadata" in enabled_apis.

Fixes bug 1002111.

Change-Id: I5aecb223876e12550394f31dbc7df893868baa8b

Include chunk_name in swift debug message

to track which image the chunk is part of when several
uploads are occurring.

Fixes LP bug #1028433.

commit_message:
Update openstack-common files.

The RPC support requires that the fanout_cast messages enable
the application to set the topic. This was fixed in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/10125/.

In addition to this the jsonutils.py was updated.

Change-Id: I85b5a3a74f129746528910d12acdd00db39d8626

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-07-23 22:09:34.000000000', 'message': 'Fix image-create --poll race-condition.

This fixes a race-condition caused by `do_image_create` with polling
enabled returning after the image has finished uploading but before the
instance `task_state` was cleared out.

This would cause a snapshot taken immediately afterwards to fail because
the `task_state` would still be in the `image_snapshot` state.

The (short-term) fix is to add an addition poll-loop that ensures the
`task_state` field is cleared-out as well.

Change-Id: I3adeed24ecea127c8bdd12143634a6ce5da64330
'}]
commit_message:
Fix image-create --poll race-condition.

This fixes a race-condition caused by `do_image_create` with polling
enabled returning after the image has finished uploading but before the
instance `task_state` was cleared out.

This would cause a snapshot taken immediately afterwards to fail because
the `task_state` would still be in the `image_snapshot` state.

The (short-term) fix is to add an addition poll-loop that ensures the
`task_state` field is cleared-out as well.

Change-Id: I3adeed24ecea127c8bdd12143634a6ce5da64330

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-07-24 14:47:46.000000000', 'message': 'Fix a bug in compute_node_statistics

Turns out, using Sqlalchemy's sum aggregation functions returns
instances of Decimal.  This caused the statistics reporting to
fail with a cryptic "Circular reference" error during
serialization.  Fixed by forcing the values to integer.

Change-Id: Ia89c191f420e116b2f7ca144cdb2e21e6ace404a
'}]
commit_message:
Fix a bug in compute_node_statistics

Turns out, using Sqlalchemy's sum aggregation functions returns
instances of Decimal.  This caused the statistics reporting to
fail with a cryptic "Circular reference" error during
serialization.  Fixed by forcing the values to integer.

Change-Id: Ia89c191f420e116b2f7ca144cdb2e21e6ace404a

commit_message:
Tolerate set_admin_password not implemented.

Allow attempts to set the root password to fail if this action
is not implemented by the virt driver.

This will allow the following nova patch to be gated:

   https://review.openstack.org/10130

Change-Id: I8be2721888f3940a215bc0f31c731231b98f05a5

commit_message:
Add v2 API support for the Cisco plugin
Blueprint cisco-plugin-v2-api-support

New meta-plugin which makes use of the Quantum db_plugin and supports
the new v2 API
Changes to the Cisco DB model, now reusing quantum DB for core attributes
Changes to the device sub plugins to access the quantum DB for core
resources' state versus Cisco DB
Addition of fake/dummy drivers to support testing of the device sub
plugins even without actual hardware
New v2 unit tests which exercise the meta-plugin and the device sub
-plugins as well
In general creating new v2 modules such that v1.x code can be deprecated
easily by deleting the older modules. The following files are v2
versions of older modules, only the imports have changed, most of the
other code is the same as from the older modules (already reviewed):
quantum/plugins/cisco/common/cisco_credentials_v2.py
quantum/plugins/cisco/db/network_db_v2.py
quantum/plugins/cisco/db/network_models_v2.py
quantum/plugins/cisco/db/nexus_db_v2.py
quantum/plugins/cisco/db/nexus_models_v2.py
quantum/plugins/cisco/db/ucs_db_v2.py
quantum/plugins/cisco/db/ucs_models_v2.py
quantum/plugins/cisco/nexus/cisco_nexus_plugin_v2.py
quantum/plugins/cisco/ucs/cisco_ucs_inventory_v2.py
quantum/plugins/cisco/ucs/cisco_ucs_plugin_v2.py
quantum/plugins/cisco/segmentation/l2network_vlan_mgr_v2.py

All changes are contained with the Cisco plugin.

(Sumit & Rohit)

Change-Id: Ib82a9f843548c286c84ba63caf5406a773ac85b1

commit_message:
Avoid casts in network manager to prevent races

 * Fixes bug 1017418
 * Includes a change to turn the floating ip casts
   into calls which is part of commit
   82599c77346bbefd550ea4ee6c0b13a3df4950af
 * These calls are to prevent race conditions that
   were preventing floating ips from being deallocated
   properly

Change-Id: I3251f02fc5fcb8305f12b6b8a9644232b9146db2
(cherry picked from commit c689891226baa8877f6fb7b3c468b06972068847)

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-07-11 15:05:39.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid lazy-loading errors on instance_type

When instances are launched with a source group, the instance_type
is not lazy_loaded in properly.

The issue is intermittent because if another query has already loaded
the instance with a joined instance_type or the instance has not
yet been expunged from the session, then the load succeeds.

Therefore this failure only appears under heavy load. Adding an
explicit joindload fixes the issue.

Change-Id: I450c598c31c416c7be341cbb8cd14e33c6bb2aec
(cherry picked from commit 2ef0dcfac78468551aac8492269ad856c312dcb5)
'}, {'created': '2012-07-24 02:52:30.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid lazy-loading errors on instance_type

When instances are launched with a source group, the instance_type
is not lazy_loaded in properly.

The issue is intermittent because if another query has already loaded
the instance with a joined instance_type or the instance has not
yet been expunged from the session, then the load succeeds.

Therefore this failure only appears under heavy load. Adding an
explicit joindload fixes the issue.

fixes bug 1018721

Change-Id: I450c598c31c416c7be341cbb8cd14e33c6bb2aec
(cherry picked from commit 2ef0dcfac78468551aac8492269ad856c312dcb5)
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid lazy-loading errors on instance_type

When instances are launched with a source group, the instance_type
is not lazy_loaded in properly.

The issue is intermittent because if another query has already loaded
the instance with a joined instance_type or the instance has not
yet been expunged from the session, then the load succeeds.

Therefore this failure only appears under heavy load. Adding an
explicit joindload fixes the issue.

fixes bug 1018721

Change-Id: I450c598c31c416c7be341cbb8cd14e33c6bb2aec
(cherry picked from commit 2ef0dcfac78468551aac8492269ad856c312dcb5)

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-07-24 04:51:14.000000000', 'message': "Xen: Fix snapshots when use_cow=True.

This fixes an issue where use_cow=True would sporadically cause snapshot
corruption.

The root cause was a race-condition where the VM's sm_config was
sometimes out-of-sync with the underlying VHDs.

The solution is to force an SR rescan immediately after taking a
snapshot so that any VHD parent-pointer modifications are propogated
into the sm_config so that _walk_vdi_chain will receive accurate
information.

Change-Id: I03b4914d9420918590ae27dfc77dfedac9c767c1
"}]
commit_message:
Xen: Fix snapshots when use_cow=True.

This fixes an issue where use_cow=True would sporadically cause snapshot
corruption.

The root cause was a race-condition where the VM's sm_config was
sometimes out-of-sync with the underlying VHDs.

The solution is to force an SR rescan immediately after taking a
snapshot so that any VHD parent-pointer modifications are propogated
into the sm_config so that _walk_vdi_chain will receive accurate
information.

Change-Id: I03b4914d9420918590ae27dfc77dfedac9c767c1

commit_message:
Port volume quota functionality in to cinderclient

* Enables quota management for volumes in cinderclient
* Changes default service_type to volume
* Updates both nova and cinder quota tables
* Runs from novaclient as well as cinderclient
* Quota code is already in Cinder, but had no interface
* Fixes bug 1023311

Change-Id: Id4958bafea114706d2ff67ecd7139dd6c06a10d2

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-07-23 16:10:50.000000000', 'message': "Added custom parser for tablesorter.js

A custom parser is needed for sorting of
custom type columns like the 'Size' columns.
The 'KB', 'MB', 'GB'... values break the sorter
logic and need to be parsed manually.

The custom parser works on all 'Size'/'RAM'/'Memory'
columns. It works also on flavor-info columns like:

    `m1.tiny | 512MB RAM | 1 VCPU | 0 Disk`

The custom parser sorts these lines based on the RAM value.

Note: as seen in horizon.tables.js file, an workaround was
added as there is one more <th> in the <thead> (incl. the table_caption)
than the <td>'s in <tbody>. Thus the custom parser needs
to be added to [i-1] header, while the header itself needs [i],
as the parser is processed in <tbody>, while headers are processed
including the table_caption... This might be a problem at some time,
although currently it works...

Fixes bug 1013475

Change-Id: I793ae330c33fde4e625f96e55fdda3748c84b8c3
"}]
commit_message:
Added custom parser for tablesorter.js

A custom parser is needed for sorting of
custom type columns like the 'Size' columns.
The 'KB', 'MB', 'GB'... values break the sorter
logic and need to be parsed manually.

The custom parser works on all 'Size'/'RAM'/'Memory'
columns. It works also on flavor-info columns like:

    `m1.tiny | 512MB RAM | 1 VCPU | 0 Disk`

The custom parser sorts these lines based on the RAM value.

Note: as seen in horizon.tables.js file, an workaround was
added as there is one more <th> in the <thead> (incl. the table_caption)
than the <td>'s in <tbody>. Thus the custom parser needs
to be added to [i-1] header, while the header itself needs [i],
as the parser is processed in <tbody>, while headers are processed
including the table_caption... This might be a problem at some time,
although currently it works...

Fixes bug 1013475

Change-Id: I793ae330c33fde4e625f96e55fdda3748c84b8c3

[{'created': '2012-07-18 04:17:28.000000000', 'message': 'Inline object creation.

Allows the creation of related objects during a workflow.
For example, this patch implements importing keypairs during
the launch instance workflow and allocating floating IP
addresses during the floating IP associate workflow.

This required several significant changes:

  * SelfHandlingForm should no long return a redirect.
    Instead, it should return either the object it
    created/acted on, or else a boolean such as True.

  * The ModalFormView now differentiates between GET
    and POST.

  * Due to the previous two items, SelfHandlingForm
    was mostly gutted (no more maybe_handle, etc.).

  * Modals now operate via a "stack" where only the
    top modal is visible at any given time and closing
    one causes the next one to become visible.

In the process of these large changes there was a large
amount of general code cleanup, especially in the javascript
code and the existing SelfHandlingForm subclasses/ModalFormView
subclasses. Many small bugs were fixed along with the cleanup.

Implements blueprint inline-object-creation.

Fixes bug 994677.
Fixes bug 1025977.

Change-Id: I1808b34cbf6f813eaedf767a6364e815c0c5e969

commit_message:
Inline object creation.

Allows the creation of related objects during a workflow.
For example, this patch implements importing keypairs during
the launch instance workflow and allocating floating IP
addresses during the floating IP associate workflow.

This required several significant changes:

  * SelfHandlingForm should no long return a redirect.
    Instead, it should return either the object it
    created/acted on, or else a boolean such as True.

  * The ModalFormView now differentiates between GET
    and POST.

  * Due to the previous two items, SelfHandlingForm
    was mostly gutted (no more maybe_handle, etc.).

  * Modals now operate via a "stack" where only the
    top modal is visible at any given time and closing
    one causes the next one to become visible.

In the process of these large changes there was a large
amount of general code cleanup, especially in the javascript
code and the existing SelfHandlingForm subclasses/ModalFormView
subclasses. Many small bugs were fixed along with the cleanup.

Implements blueprint inline-object-creation.

Fixes bug 994677.
Fixes bug 1025977.
Fixes bug 1027342.
Fixes bug 1025919.

Change-Id: I1808b34cbf6f813eaedf767a6364e815c0c5e969

commit_message:
Add call to get hypervisor statistics

Adds an admin API call to retrieve the compute node statistics for an
entire nova instance.  Counts up all hypervisors and sums all their
values (vcpus, vcpus_used, etc.).

Change-Id: I0a3df235282089f1313d08ae5b89dadbd1db9840

commit_message:
Use compute_driver in vmware driver help messages.

Updates the help messages in the vmware driver to use 'compute_driver'
examples instead of 'connection_type' which is now deprecated.

Change-Id: Iddea2cabc841200edd561d71f0c11fd6ba272f5d

commit_message:
Update NovaKeystoneContext to use jsonutils.

Minor fix to use jsonutils.loads instead of json.loads to
standardize w/ the rest of Nova.

Change-Id: I4a6912d29fbe425b29bd1b170b9bec19e3bfc46e

And another case from 2008:
http://permalink.gmane.org/gmane.comp.file-systems.fuse.devel/6502

Change-Id: I36fd11d5f01562f65a6b6f07e759ea066490b067
'}]
commit_message:
ensure libguestfs has completed before proceeding

This avoids a FUSE issue referenced here:
http://code.google.com/p/s3ql/issues/detail?id=159
which in turn references this thread on the subject from 2006:
http://thread.gmane.org/gmane.comp.file-systems.fuse.devel/3903
And another case from 2008:
http://permalink.gmane.org/gmane.comp.file-systems.fuse.devel/6502

The vast majority of this work was reproducing and classifying
done by David Naori and Richard W.M. Jones at:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=835466

Fixes bug: 1013689
Change-Id: I36fd11d5f01562f65a6b6f07e759ea066490b067

commit_message:
Use size_checked_iter in v2 API

The image file returned in the v2 API should be treated the same
as in the v1 API. This patch wraps the returned image data in
the v2 API controller with glance.api.common.size_checked_iter

Change-Id: If7514a4394b17844d92b9737214898f954fe95a6

commit_message:
Updates api.openstack.org to v2 instead of v1.1 for Compute API.

Adds some additional details to createServer.
 - Fix bug 933547 by adding imageRef, flavorRef to create Server
 - Adds metadata and personality to create Server command

Change-Id: I8970bec78164fec7bcab93960ca145273f858824

Talked to Jay on IRC, will push back two-way ssl to a future patch. I would like to have it before v1.0.0 though.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-07-12 02:15:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

So it looks like we would have to to ssl cert validation manually, httplib doesn't do it for us :( I'm going to look for an alternative to httplib."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-07-12 02:40:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Work In Progress

httplib2 might not work for us'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-07-12 02:40:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

The important part of this to have now is the interface change, so I broke that out into a different patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/9697/'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-07-12 14:56:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

We use httplib and SSL just fine in the original glance client code... what's wrong with using that?"}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-07-12 15:03:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

httplib doesn't validate the cert, as far as I can tell. It speak the https protocol, but it's essentially in insecure mode."}, {'account_id': 455, 'date': '2012-07-17 10:12:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Hi Brian,

You're right that httplib doesn't do cert validation -- we were able work around this for v1 by modifying the 'connect' method. pycurl seems to have better ssl support but by default it is built against gnutls which means it suffers from this issue: http://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=515200. (A custom build against openssl would get around that ... not sure how palatable that is.)"}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-07-19 23:57:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Stuart:

If you think it's an acceptable path forward, I'm just going to port in the ssl validation code from the old client."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-07-23 16:15:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-07-23 16:17:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-07-23 16:35:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Works for me

commit_message:
Replace httplib2 with httplib as http driver

* This allows us to send truly chunked responses to users
* Handle bad connection url schemes with a new InvalidEndpoint exception
* Fixes bug 1023240

Change-Id: I34500987f51d4e0c6e1f89ecf93853de3fcbb1c3

commit_message:
Log snapshot UUID and not OpaqueRef.

The OpaqueRef doesn't help troubleshooting since it can't be easily used
to identify an image after the session finishes. UUID, which is
invariant, is much more useful.

Change-Id: I3b802e41e583bee84ee6f5d05e1ffc581761571d

commit_message:
Port nova-rootwrap changes to cinder-rootwrap

Port recent nova-rootwrap changes to cinder-rootwrap, including:
* Move filter definition from Python module to configuration files
* Fix tests execution on Fedora (bug 1027814)
* Remove executable bit on cinder/rootwrap files

This certainly needs a matching change to devstack to pass gating.

Change-Id: I963bc7890ba285ae515ea61bbd960bd2523f9061

commit_message:
Expand network troubleshooting section

Move troubleshooting from a subsubsection of Networking
(under floating IPs) to a subsection.

Add content about disabling reverse path filtering.

Add content about temporarily disabling firewall.

Patch set makes the xml:id="network-troubleshooting" and attempts to
address ambiguity pointed out in bug 1024321.

Cherry pick from https://review.openstack.org/9494

Change-Id: If3911b8920bddba16b72a75ba2d5a0c5b360d0ed

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-07-23 16:27:04.000000000', 'message': 'Update jsonutils from openstack-common.

commit 9e1bd9d9313a9f324c5b7b02232e8bd2fd12ea8a
Author: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>
Date:   Wed Jul 18 16:47:34 2012 -0400

    Add missing convert_instances arg.

    When calling jsonutils.to_primitive() recursively, the convert_instances
    argument should be passed along.  This change fixes one place where it
    was not.

commit 2d6f84742a3e8ea51ebbfb82cbeacefe97e199d5
Author: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>
Date:   Wed Jul 18 16:15:52 2012 -0400

    Track to_primitive() depth after iteritems().

    Change jsonutils.to_primitive() to increase the recursion depth counter
    when calling to_primitive() on the result of iteritems() from the
    current element.  Previously, the only time the counter was increased
    was when converting the __dict__ from an object.  The iteritems() case
    risks cycles, as well.

    I hit a problem with this when trying to call to_primitive on an
    instance of nova.db.sqlalchemy.models.Instance.  An Instance includes a
    reference to InstanceInfoCache, which has a reference back to the
    Instance.  Without this change, to_primitive() would raise an exception
    for an Instance due to excessive recursion.

    Related to nova blueprint no-db-messaging.

Change-Id: Iaa49ea08b406a38840e8a0b5466d48f2d3f7e840
'}]
commit_message:
Update jsonutils from openstack-common.

commit 9e1bd9d9313a9f324c5b7b02232e8bd2fd12ea8a
Author: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>
Date:   Wed Jul 18 16:47:34 2012 -0400

    Add missing convert_instances arg.

    When calling jsonutils.to_primitive() recursively, the convert_instances
    argument should be passed along.  This change fixes one place where it
    was not.

commit 2d6f84742a3e8ea51ebbfb82cbeacefe97e199d5
Author: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>
Date:   Wed Jul 18 16:15:52 2012 -0400

    Track to_primitive() depth after iteritems().

    Change jsonutils.to_primitive() to increase the recursion depth counter
    when calling to_primitive() on the result of iteritems() from the
    current element.  Previously, the only time the counter was increased
    was when converting the __dict__ from an object.  The iteritems() case
    risks cycles, as well.

    I hit a problem with this when trying to call to_primitive on an
    instance of nova.db.sqlalchemy.models.Instance.  An Instance includes a
    reference to InstanceInfoCache, which has a reference back to the
    Instance.  Without this change, to_primitive() would raise an exception
    for an Instance due to excessive recursion.

    Related to nova blueprint no-db-messaging.

Change-Id: Iaa49ea08b406a38840e8a0b5466d48f2d3f7e840

[{'created': '2012-07-23 10:38:01.000000000', 'message': 'Adding networking rules to vm's on compute service startup

Fixes bug 1027105

Restarting nova-compute resulted in a new empty iptables chain
"nova-compute-FORWARD" being create. This commit adds a single
call to plug_vifs which ensures the appropriate filters (and
bridge) are present on service startup.

Change-Id: I51cbb56acbb244ddddd951a26d3168cf5a9c0314
'}]
commit_message:
Adding networking rules to vm's on compute service startup

Fixes bug 1027105

Restarting nova-compute resulted in a new empty iptables chain
"nova-compute-FORWARD" being create. This commit adds a single
call to plug_vifs which ensures the appropriate filters (and
bridge) are present on service startup.

Change-Id: I51cbb56acbb244ddddd951a26d3168cf5a9c0314

commit_message:
Fix problem with logger and libc loader

If fallocate can't be loaded from libc, bit posix_fallocate loaded
user will Swift will log warning messages. So it will be better
to write log only if both version of fallocate can't be loaded.

Change-Id: I2a9ffe4756e77b3010ccd82b33c208d6d9b9f7b7

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-07-23 13:27:34.000000000', 'message': "Make it clear subnet_bits is unused in ipam case

In NetworkManager.create_networks(), the subnet_bits variable is unused
where 'ipam' is passed as a parameter - i.e. when the method is called
from QuantumNovaIPAMLib. This is because in the ipam case we never
carve up the IP range into multiple networks.

Move the variable around so that its usage scope is more obvious.

Change-Id: I2a1a2cb63f9864c15b33b30f1bf995a50a6ec067
"}]
commit_message:
Make it clear subnet_bits is unused in ipam case

In NetworkManager.create_networks(), the subnet_bits variable is unused
where 'ipam' is passed as a parameter - i.e. when the method is called
from QuantumNovaIPAMLib. This is because in the ipam case we never
carve up the IP range into multiple networks.

Move the variable around so that its usage scope is more obvious.

Change-Id: I2a1a2cb63f9864c15b33b30f1bf995a50a6ec067

[{'created': '2012-07-20 22:41:14.000000000', 'message': "Adds non_inheritable_image_properties flag.

Some image-properties should not be inherited from the instance when
taking a snapshot because we want that functionality to only available
for the base-image, not subsequent snapshots.

As an example, we would like 'cache_in_nova' fast-cloning to be
available just for base-images and not customer snapshots created off a
base-image.

This patch adds a new configuration which allows operators to, at
runtime, select which image-properties should not be inherited by newly
created snapshots.

Change-Id: I8d7781b05ffd71a59ba69fb7c3df4616cba94cce
"}]
commit_message:
Adds non_inheritable_image_properties flag.

Some image-properties should not be inherited from the instance when
taking a snapshot because we want that functionality to only available
for the base-image, not subsequent snapshots.

As an example, we would like 'cache_in_nova' fast-cloning to be
available just for base-images and not customer snapshots created off a
base-image.

This patch adds a new configuration which allows operators to, at
runtime, select which image-properties should not be inherited by newly
created snapshots.

Change-Id: I8d7781b05ffd71a59ba69fb7c3df4616cba94cce

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-07-23 08:43:54.000000000', 'message': "Avoid unrecognized content-type message

Fixes bug #904473

If the client does not include a Content-type header in its request
(which is normal for e.g. GET and DELETE) then eventlet will pass us
'text/plain'.

Because 'text/plain' isn't one of our supported request content types
we log:

  Unrecognized Content-Type provided in request

This can be an annoying red-herring for people debugging issues.

The reason that eventlet defaults to text/plain is because it uses
the mimetools.Message.gettype() method:

  Message.gettype()
    Return the message type [..] as specified in the Content-Type
    header. If no such header exists, return 'text/plain'.

The wsgiref web server has the same behavior, whereas mod_wsgi will
pass no content-type and twisted will pass an empty string.

Make our code more robust by treating the empty string or text/plain
as if no content-type header was supplied.

Change-Id: Ide117c807db0dc0f5cbe974788b604b5e236800a
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid unrecognized content-type message

Fixes bug #904473

If the client does not include a Content-type header in its request
(which is normal for e.g. GET and DELETE) then eventlet will pass us
'text/plain'.

Because 'text/plain' isn't one of our supported request content types
we log:

  Unrecognized Content-Type provided in request

This can be an annoying red-herring for people debugging issues.

The reason that eventlet defaults to text/plain is because it uses
the mimetools.Message.gettype() method:

  Message.gettype()
    Return the message type [..] as specified in the Content-Type
    header. If no such header exists, return 'text/plain'.

The wsgiref web server has the same behavior, whereas mod_wsgi will
pass no content-type and twisted will pass an empty string.

Make our code more robust by treating the empty string or text/plain
as if no content-type header was supplied.

Change-Id: Ide117c807db0dc0f5cbe974788b604b5e236800a

commit_message:
Don't set device='cdrom' for all disks in libvirt driver

When the root disk image was tagged as being an ISO image,
the libvirt driver would mistakenly set device='cdrom' for
all disks, instead of just the first image

Change-Id: Idf29df5c460f8ebefd2e462a53d72280d5af4c5e
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>

subject: Migrations for deleted data for previously deleted instances.
messages:
[{'account_id': 177, 'date': '2012-07-09 14:53:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I realize checking within 2 seconds is a little shady but I don't have any other ideas on how to determine which data should be undeleted."}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-07-13 18:00:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

* Your migration(s) need to be renumbered; we're up to 110_* now.
* I don't understand why you have 3 migrations; seems to me that a single migration would be the best way to address this.
* I don't understand why marking the metadata, etc. as deleted when the instance is deleted is wrong; seems to me that failing to do so could cause a leak in the database.  Can you explain why the new behavior is desired in preference to the old behavior?"}, {'account_id': 177, 'date': '2012-07-16 15:38:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I just figured each migration covered a different area, but I can compress them.

Part of not setting metadata to deleted is just a matter of preference. The other part is we needed a way to know what the metadata for a deleted instance was when it was deleted, if we deleted all of the metadata then we could potentially have duplicate metadata for an instance that would complicate usage reporting for billing. For example this would happen for instances that underwent a rebuild. 

The database can still easily be pruned by looking at the link between metadata and its deleted instance.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-07-16 15:52:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

If each migration really covers a different area, then you would need three separate patches; but I think you have things properly combined here.  Keep in mind that pretty much all the migrations will end up getting merged anyway as part of the release cycle.  Given that, I think your migrations in this patch should be merged into a single migration.  (It will probably also make your work a little easier…)

As for the issue of deleting metadata…I'm still not entirely convinced; you wouldn't set new metadata on an instance that has already been deleted, and we use the whole deleted=True paradigm anyway for keeping that information around.  Maybe I'm missing something?  Having this answer included as part of the commit message would be good, too, by the way…"}, {'account_id': 177, 'date': '2012-07-16 16:47:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-07-16 17:05:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

commit_message:
Migrations for deleted data for previously deleted instances.

These migrations undelete metadata, system metadata, and block device mappings
that were deleted when instances were deleted before the change:
0598db0a6c66eb2b6d2e0e3f0b3b2b921ebe8621

Before that change; metadata, system metadata, and block device mappings were
deleted when and instance was deleted, this is no longer the behavior.
These migrations undelete all of the data that was deleted within two
seconds of the instance being deleted in order for old deleted instances
to be consistent with the new behavior.

Fixes bug 1022592

Change-Id: I36c66913abcb231f23e409f1f71c00ef0f6e69e5

commit_message:
Add missing convert_instances arg.

When calling jsonutils.to_primitive() recursively, the convert_instances
argument should be passed along.  This change fixes one place where it
was not.

Change-Id: I536e1ca05bb4e613fba71298797879587e8b4b00

commit_message:
Update iteritems test case to actually test iteritems.

This patch updates the jsonutils.to_primitive() test case for when an
object has an iteritems() method.  The previous implementation was
mostly a copy of another test and didn't actually test calling
iteritems() at all.  Now it does.

This is used by NovaBase in nova.db.sqlalchemy.models.

Related to nova blueprint no-db-messaging.

Change-Id: Ie1d71b859219392ab35b82dd3c7932b30e759c89

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-07-23 15:01:11.000000000', 'message': 'Track to_primitive() depth after iteritems().

Change jsonutils.to_primitive() to increase the recursion depth counter
when calling to_primitive() on the result of iteritems() from the
current element.  Previously, the only time the counter was increased
was when converting the __dict__ from an object.  The iteritems() case
risks cycles, as well.

I hit a problem with this when trying to call to_primitive on an
instance of nova.db.sqlalchemy.models.Instance.  An Instance includes a
reference to InstanceInfoCache, which has a reference back to the
Instance.  Without this change, to_primitive() would raise an exception
for an Instance due to excessive recursion.

Related to nova blueprint no-db-messaging.

Change-Id: Ifb878368d97e92ab6c361a4dd5f5ab2e68fc16e2
'}]
commit_message:
Track to_primitive() depth after iteritems().

Change jsonutils.to_primitive() to increase the recursion depth counter
when calling to_primitive() on the result of iteritems() from the
current element.  Previously, the only time the counter was increased
was when converting the __dict__ from an object.  The iteritems() case
risks cycles, as well.

I hit a problem with this when trying to call to_primitive on an
instance of nova.db.sqlalchemy.models.Instance.  An Instance includes a
reference to InstanceInfoCache, which has a reference back to the
Instance.  Without this change, to_primitive() would raise an exception
for an Instance due to excessive recursion.

Related to nova blueprint no-db-messaging.

Change-Id: Ifb878368d97e92ab6c361a4dd5f5ab2e68fc16e2

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-07-23 14:57:56.000000000', 'message': "Make test_zmq bind/send to 127.0.0.1

By default, the impl_zmq driver binds to '*' (0.0.0.0);
For the purposes of testing, we only need to bind to 127.0.0.1.
Binding to all interfaces could be potentially dangerous, may simply not
work in some environments, etc. In particular, we do not want our
Jenkins slaves to be listening on public interfaces.

rpc_zmq_host is set to 127.0.0.1 as well, which avoids hostname
resolution. Normally, rpc_zmq_host is set to socket.hostname, which
normally should resolve to localhost, but we do not want to test that here.

Change-Id: I1224799bb399ceaf79088dd622be4b6823f29a41
"}, {'created': '2012-07-23 14:57:56.000000000', 'message': 'test_zmq only listens on localhost

Change-Id: I1224799bb399ceaf79088dd622be4b6823f29a41
'}]
commit_message:
Make test_zmq bind/send to 127.0.0.1

By default, the impl_zmq driver binds to '*' (0.0.0.0);
For the purposes of testing, we only need to bind to 127.0.0.1.
Binding to all interfaces could be potentially dangerous, may simply not
work in some environments, etc. In particular, we do not want our
Jenkins slaves to be listening on public interfaces.

rpc_zmq_host is set to 127.0.0.1 as well, which avoids hostname
resolution. Normally, rpc_zmq_host is set to socket.hostname, which
normally should resolve to localhost, but we do not want to test that here.

Change-Id: I1224799bb399ceaf79088dd622be4b6823f29a41

the user to define the topic.

Troubleshooting packet drops across bridge with VLAN

Added a section in troubleshooting networking related to packets
being dropped in VLAN mode.

Docs are based on this blog post:

commit_message:
fixes for nova-manage not returning a full list of fixed IPs

This fix correct the problem reported in bug 930193
nova-manage does not return a full list of fixed IPs. The reason
is that the call to fixed_ip['instance_id'] can throw exception
when fixed_ip does not have instance_id as its member. The changes
in this fix corrects the problem.
rebase to resolve the automatic merge issue.

Change-Id: Ic15a0a0f43f53b82f9d88a03803c96b44a8ddcb9

commit_message:
Fix EC2 CreateImage no_reboot logic

Previously the call to restart the imaged instance was incorrect.

This is now fixed and unit tested.

Change-Id: Ifde193e084ecdbc37a57150f28d833ae276f49c6

commit_message:
Reject EC2 CreateImage for instance-store

For fidelity with AWS, we explicitly do not support the EC2 CreateImage
API for the analogue of instance-store-backed instances.

Change-Id: I266a021ce53dbb1f521201f1cdc614b08c31bf8d

commit_message:
Promote volumes content from section to chapter.

This change takes the content about volumes out of the System Admin
chapter and puts it in a new chapter called volumes.

This is a pure refactoring, no content has been modified.

Cherry-picked from https://review.openstack.org/9482

Change-Id: I7482925cd008009eb4f433c3c93ffda20cbbfc89

The bug number should not be listed in the first line of the commit message. It should be on a line of its own, immediately prior to the Change-id: line. The commit message should also mention that this is the libvirt driver. My recommendation is thus:

  Make libvirt driver set the create correct size of qcow2 disk file.

  When using live block migration, ephemeral disks with qcow2 format
  should be created in the destination with the same virtual size
  as before.

  bug 977007
  Change-Id: I5c5b1295bdb3e4dc281698eba38c5ce697aa9bc2
  (cherry picked from commit ee705d048418d63667136cad3951655178861d46)"}, {'account_id': 1119, 'date': '2012-07-23 09:27:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1119, 'date': '2012-07-23 09:28:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
libvirt: fix qcow2 size on live block migration

When using live block migration, ephemeral disks with qcow2 format
should be created in the destination with the same virtual size as
before.

bug 977007

Change-Id: I5c5b1295bdb3e4dc281698eba38c5ce697aa9bc2
(cherry picked from commit ee705d048418d63667136cad3951655178861d46)

commit_message:
autoscaling: don't kill all instances when scaling down

only delete the difference between the old capacity and the new capacity

doh!

Change-Id: Idbb16b2fa93abcad2793d5b4365c18a01e588b99
Signed-off-by: Angus Salkeld <asalkeld@redhat.com>
