Don't mind Jenkins. There was a fluke in the gate job reporting. The tests all actually passed."}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-07-11 23:14:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Do not merge

I very much dislike setting compute states in network api. I could be convinced to go with it, but I setting compute states in the network manager is definitely a no-no.

Ideally the associate and disassociate calls should be passed to compute_api.associate and disassociate which can set the state and then delegate to the network_api to make the calls. Otherwise the new quantum integration (which will replace network.api will not get the benefit of this code. We should really be doing this anyway in order to set the network cache properly, however, so I would begrudgingly be ok with those changes going into another commit.

I am definitely blocking this in this on modifying compute state from the network host however. If we simply have to do the above change in a later commit, please at least modify this code to do the final state update in network.api after the call and leave network manager alone.'}, {'account_id': 1816, 'date': '2012-07-12 01:23:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: No score

I was pretty much waiting for that -2, Vish ;-) Just wanted to get the conversation started.

So, are you saying you would accept a patch that moved those API calls to methods in the compute API? I don't mind writing that code; I just want to make sure you're actually in favor of it.

I also don't quite understand your comment about unsetting the states at the API layer... the RPC calls are asynchronous, so the code flow doesn't go back through the API layer after it's actually finished the task, right?

One way or the other I'd really like to see these state changes happen somehow 'cuz it's one of the most frustrating user experience problems in Horizon right now."}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-07-12 04:42:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

It is using calls, not casts, so the control flow actually does return after the rpc.call and you can set the state there.

Ultimately, yes, I think a call through compute api is probably best, so if you want to go ahead and take the plunge on that one it would be awesome.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-07-20 06:03:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-07-20 06:03:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Set instance task_state during floating IP association.

To provide more meaningful feedback to an end user, set the
instance task state to task_states.NETWORKING when the API
call is received, and set it back to None after the RPC
call actually completes its task. This way anyone wondering
if the floating IP is actually in the process of being associated
can query the instance and find out, and interfaces like Horizon
can check for updates while in this intermediate state.

Change-Id: I45be17a2217aefe9b81c1ce590feb49cf61bdbb0

subject: Image folder naming convention in libvirt driver.
messages:
[{'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2012-07-12 10:07:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

This commit message is not sufficiently descriptive. You need to clearly describe what the old and new naming conventions were/are. You should also describe why the new naming convention is better.

I see nothing wrong with your code changes on a technical level. I just wonder what motivates this change. In libvirt, whenever storing VM related files on disk, we've always preferred to use the name, and not the uuid, because when admins come across a file on disk, it is more obvious to them where it comes from if it has the human friendly name, and not uuid. So I'd like the commit message to describe why this change is a good idea, if indeed it is - I'm yet to be convinced."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-07-12 10:25:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Doesn't seem to work

commit_message:
Image folder naming convention in libvirt driver.

Today libvirt driver in Nova names instance folders according to instance name (e.g., "instance-001"), which is not unique.
Using the uuid of the instance instead will make it much easier to handle several scenarios,
including migration (verify availability of the instance on the target node),
as well as instance rebuild for HA (for similar purpose, when shared storage is in place).

The fix is mainly replacing instance['name'] with instance['uuid'] in a bunch of places in libvirt/driver.py.

Opened bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1023865

Change-Id: I000fc0d4cb04149373ba1b4f286ff19bb2d20925

Updates the Swift keystoneauth middleware so that it supports individual
ACL permissions with tenant_id:user_id.

The motivation for this change is to avoid hard coding usernames
in swift object permissions. I'd like to be able to use ID's
for both user and tenant.

Fixes LP Bug #1020709.

Change-Id: I5ab3184af083cf6bf72d11c3d2c2c5a02018cee4
"}]
commit_message:
Updates keystoneauth to support ACL's w/ user_id.

Updates the Swift keystoneauth middleware so that it supports individual
ACL permissions with tenant_id:user_id.

The motivation for this change is to avoid hard coding usernames
in swift object permissions. I'd like to be able to use ID's
for both user and tenant.

Adds test case to cover tenant_id:user_id case.

Fixes LP Bug #1020709.

Change-Id: I5ab3184af083cf6bf72d11c3d2c2c5a02018cee4

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-07-19 17:21:31.000000000', 'message': 'Fix SQL deadlock in quota reservations

Fixes bug 1026709

The code in quota_reserve acquires SQL locks in a different order than
the code in reservation_commit/reservation_rollback. This can result in
an SQL deadlock under heavy load. Due to an (unrelated) bug in
SQLAlchemy, this can result in this exception:

ResourceClosedError: This result object does not return rows. It has
been closed automatically.

This patch reorganizes the code to always fetch (and thusly lock) the
quota_usages table before the reservations table.

Change-Id: Ia364496a996870d754094915ea0501ff19052037
'}, {'created': '2012-07-19 18:06:57.000000000', 'message': 'Fix SQL deadlock in quota reservations

Fixes bug 1026709

The code in quota_reserve acquires SQL locks in a different order than
the code in reservation_commit/reservation_rollback. This can result in
an SQL deadlock under heavy load. Due to an (unrelated) bug in
SQLAlchemy, this can result in this exception:

ResourceClosedError: This result object does not return rows. It has
been closed automatically.

This patch reorganizes the code to always fetch (and thusly lock) the
quota_usages table before the reservations table.

Change-Id: Ia364496a996870d754094915ea0501ff19052037
'}]
commit_message:
Fix SQL deadlock in quota reservations

Fixes bug 1026709

The code in quota_reserve acquires SQL locks in a different order than
the code in reservation_commit/reservation_rollback. This can result in
an SQL deadlock under heavy load. Due to an (unrelated) bug in
SQLAlchemy, this can result in this exception:

ResourceClosedError: This result object does not return rows. It has
been closed automatically.

This patch reorganizes the code to always fetch (and thusly lock) the
quota_usages table before the reservations table.

Change-Id: Ia364496a996870d754094915ea0501ff19052037

commit_message:
Add pagination to v1 image-list

* Use recursive generator function to make subsequent requests
  to the v1 detailed images resource
* 'limit' continues to act as the absolute limit of images to return
  from a list call
* 'page_size' indicates how many images to ask for in each subsequent
  pagination request
* Expose --page-size through the cli
* Convert v1 images tests to use strict url comparison
* Drop strict_url_check from FakeAPI kwargs - now the functionality
  is always active and tests must directly match fixture urls
* Fix bug 1024614

Change-Id: Ifa7874d88360e03b5c8aa95bfb9d5e6dc6dc927e

commit_message:
Wrap image data in iterator

This is establishing the API for a future optimization. We want to
be able to offer true socket-level caching, but can't do that with
httplib2 right now. For now, we will just fake the optimization
by returning an iterator over the image body, which happens to already
be fully loaded into a string.

Change-Id: I2d36e3cdd45b26d7c7c27ba050bf6a4b5765df6c

commit_message:
Static FaultWrapper status_to_type map.

Avoid maintaining needless copies of this dict, by instantiating
lazily once and only once.

This approach will bring master into sync with the corresponding
patch proposed to stable/essex:

  https://review.openstack.org/9446

Change-Id: I8a7cd5fc4fe0effd436e91a6c481df7b0d5a8b01

commit_message:
cleanup dependent data upon user/tenant deletion

fixes bug 974199
fixes bug 973243

* upon deletion of tenant also delete user tenant relations
* upon deletion of tenant or user also delete corresponding metadata
* add foreign keys in metadata to ensure consistency

see also: https://bugs.launchpad.net/keystone/+bug/959294/comments/16

Change-Id: I264714fe82b727e3e0f5273bcb781a580a3f3826

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-07-19 09:44:09.000000000', 'message': "Sync jsonutils from openstack-common

This makes keystone work with recent versions of anyjson.

Changes from openstack-common:

    commit ce3071437d1871f77c4d8573cbe5f4ea8c817650
    Author: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>
    Date:   Mon Jul 16 10:30:25 2012 -0400

        Use strtime() in to_primitive() for datetime objs.

        This patch updates jsonutils.to_primitive() to use timeutils.strtime()
        to convert a datimetime object to a string instead of just using str().
        This ensures that we can easily convert the string back to a datetime
        using timeutils.parse_strtime().

        Required for the nova blueprint no-db-messaging.

        Change-Id: I725b333695930e12e2832378102514326fec639c

    commit 4c9d439ef24f5afdd74aa9153aa8fc772051e6cb
    Author: Tim Daly Jr <timjr@yahoo-inc.com>
    Date:   Tue Jun 26 02:48:42 2012 +0000

        Add 'filedecoder' method to the jsonutils wrapper module.

        Fixes bug #1017765

        After version 3.3.2, the anyjson library will throw a KeyError if
        filedecoder isn't present.  The filedecoder is just like the decoder
        except it takes a file instead of a string, like json.load() instead
        of json.loads().

        Change-Id: I7bd012a7b4afa9b1ec987c3e6393cc922b5dadff

Change-Id: Icfd5c39c322ed6e73148c7f5ae03f704a3aa160e
"}]
commit_message:
Sync jsonutils from openstack-common

This makes keystone work with recent versions of anyjson.

Changes from openstack-common:

    commit ce3071437d1871f77c4d8573cbe5f4ea8c817650
    Author: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>
    Date:   Mon Jul 16 10:30:25 2012 -0400

        Use strtime() in to_primitive() for datetime objs.

        This patch updates jsonutils.to_primitive() to use timeutils.strtime()
        to convert a datimetime object to a string instead of just using str().
        This ensures that we can easily convert the string back to a datetime
        using timeutils.parse_strtime().

        Required for the nova blueprint no-db-messaging.

        Change-Id: I725b333695930e12e2832378102514326fec639c

    commit 4c9d439ef24f5afdd74aa9153aa8fc772051e6cb
    Author: Tim Daly Jr <timjr@yahoo-inc.com>
    Date:   Tue Jun 26 02:48:42 2012 +0000

        Add 'filedecoder' method to the jsonutils wrapper module.

        Fixes bug #1017765

        After version 3.3.2, the anyjson library will throw a KeyError if
        filedecoder isn't present.  The filedecoder is just like the decoder
        except it takes a file instead of a string, like json.load() instead
        of json.loads().

        Change-Id: I7bd012a7b4afa9b1ec987c3e6393cc922b5dadff

Change-Id: Icfd5c39c322ed6e73148c7f5ae03f704a3aa160e

commit_message:
Allow nested stacks to be retrieved by name

When getting the stack by name in the metadata server
we don't know the owner_id so allow retrieval just by name.

I suspect this will be a short term solution until we get proper
stack names.

Change-Id: I8845b2b33a5bae30aae66c06af01c1a27c990305
Signed-off-by: Angus Salkeld <asalkeld@redhat.com>

commit_message:
fix bug lp:1025526,update iniparser.py to accept  empty value.

also,this patch turn off pep8 E125 check,this for now seems to
be unnecessary,it check continuous line split.and update the
latest openstack-common https://review.openstack.org/#/c/9201
which has fix pep8 1.3 issue except for E125 check.

Change-Id: I86e6a3add56a0a2941031a1248f1696667ac56b8

commit_message:
Added user name validation. Fixes bug 966251.

1. Verified name length while creating/updating user.
2. Disallowed blank user name in create/update.
3. Added unit test coverage.

Change-Id: I55cd5daf34f4f57d4163be403a7a75c5d22baa62

[{'created': '2012-07-17 23:31:48.000000000', 'message': "Move checked_iter from v1 API glance.api.common

The checked_iter image streaming wrapper should be in a common
place so the v2 API code can use it as well. This moves it to
glance/api/common.py and gives it a slightly more descriptive
name 'size_checked_iter'.

Change-Id: I9fbf2c76666bfc0b9227a6a6c4d824367526e56a
"}]
commit_message:
Move checked_iter from v1 API glance.api.common

The checked_iter image streaming wrapper should be in a common
place so the v2 API code can use it as well. This moves it to
glance/api/common.py and gives it a slightly more descriptive
name 'size_checked_iter'.

Change-Id: I9fbf2c76666bfc0b9227a6a6c4d824367526e56a

Increase wait time for test_unsupported_default_store

Fix for LP Bug #1026047.

Allow unit test 'test_unsupported_default_store' to
successfully run on a slow machine.

Change-Id: I4d49c821aeb3027b7f33babf6c4bafe00644f0c9

commit_message:
Ensure that dnsmasq is terminated when running unstack.sh

If the Quantum dhcp-agent is enabled then we ensure that the dnsmasq
process is termated when running unstack.sh

Change-Id: I0aee8b806c61dff42400a3b8552b7c748e9c5adf

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-07-17 03:58:26.000000000', 'message': 'Remove unused get_{id,version}_from_href()

The former is only used in the compute API in Nova to e.g. get
an image or flavor ID from a client supplied ref.

The latter is unused even in Nova since the removal of the 1.0
API.

Change-Id: I4e00ca816820cb51c0ab3d4d864766d981854939
'}]
commit_message:
Remove unused get_{id,version}_from_href()

The former is only used in the compute API in Nova to e.g. get
an image or flavor ID from a client supplied ref.

The latter is unused even in Nova since the removal of the 1.0
API.

Change-Id: I4e00ca816820cb51c0ab3d4d864766d981854939

subject: 2.5x increase in default volume backing file size
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1, 'name': 'James E. Blair', 'email': 'jim@acmegating.com', 'username': 'corvus'}, {'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7, 'name': 'Jay Pipes', 'email': 'jaypipes@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaypipes'}, {'_account_id': 67, 'name': 'Vish Ishaya', 'email': 'vishvananda@gmail.com', 'username': 'vishvananda'}, {'_account_id': 970, 'name': 'Dean Troyer', 'email': 'dtroyer@gmail.com', 'username': 'dtroyer'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 2284, 'name': 'Eoghan Glynn', 'email': 'eglynn@redhat.com', 'username': 'eglynn'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-07-15 09:43:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build successful

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-devstack-merge/678/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/3887/testReport : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-07-16 16:13:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

LOL, yeah, I made the devstack-gate scripts change the backing volume size to 4G so that Tempest's volume tests didn't bomb immediately :)"}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-07-16 17:56:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2012-07-18 17:03:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Raising the default to 10G will break other folk using DevStack on smallish VMs.

Why is it necessary to change the default rather than just set VOLUME_BACKING_FILE_SIZE in localrc?"}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-07-18 17:14:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: No score

Yes, I agree with Dean... I was pointing out that I change the VOLUME_BACKING_FILE_SIZE to 4G in the Tempest devstack gate scripts' localrc file."}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-07-18 17:25:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Fair enough, chaps.

The point was to allow exercises that require headroom for multiple volumes/snapshots, such as the new ec2_create_image proposed here:

  https://review.openstack.org/9853

to work out-of-the-box.

I guess I could skip that test by default, though that does defeat the purpose somewhat.

Cheers,
Eoghan'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2012-07-18 18:10:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

You could have ex2_create_image look at VOLUME_BACKING_FILE_SIZE and decide if it has enough room to run and exit with code 55 if it doesn't.  That is the magic code for an exercise script to skip itself and continue exercise.sh execution.  That would let it run by default when it can at least."}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-07-18 19:57:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

+1 to deans suggestion of exiting if there isn't enough space. Also, I think 5GB is a reasonable middle ground. 5 volumes should be plenty for testing and you can reasonably expect 5 gigs free in most test vms (ec2 root disk is 10g for example, as well as most vagrant images)."}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-07-18 21:11:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-07-18 21:15:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Great suggestions guys ...

The latest patch set has Vish's suggested compromise limit of 5Gb, and I've incorporated into https://review.openstack.org/9853 Dean's suggestion of bailing with 55 when the actual size is less than that threshold.

Cheers,
Eoghan"}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-07-18 21:33:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-07-18 21:34:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build successful

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-devstack-merge/727/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/4152/testReport : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2012-07-18 21:49:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

Comment inline about the placement of the default.

Also a corresponding change needs to be made to cinder in lib/cinder."}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2012-07-18 21:53:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

OK, I see why the default is in stackrc.  The cinder comment stands.'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-07-19 11:47:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-07-19 11:48:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

@dtroyer

Good spot on the lib/cinder aspect, addressed in the latest patch-set.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-07-19 12:15:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

commit_message:
2.5x increase in default volume backing file size

The current default volume backing file size of ~2Gb seem unfeasibly
small and precludes running exercises that require multiple volumes
and/or snapshots to be created.

We increase this to ~5Gb.

Change-Id: Id6b8d122be919d1b0041288e81b735af21958ff7

commit_message:
Add missing gettextutils from openstack-common.

This patch adds gettextutils from openstack-common to cinder.  It is used
by rpc, so some parts of rpc are broken without this patch.

Change-Id: I0830319f4e2011b87180abcc24354c935bea8d16

commit_message:
Use save_and_reraise_exception() from common.

This patch common.excutils from openstack-common, which includes
save_and_reraise_exception().  The patch also converts the code
base to use it from there instead of cinder.utils and then removes
it from cinder.utils.

The initial motivation for this was removing another cinder dependency
from cinder.rpc so that it can eventually be moved to openstack-common.

Change-Id: I7354ca51a02aec9c709cf33f77d4abc46acc2742

commit_message:
Use openstack.common.cfg.CONF.

Part of blueprint common-rpc.

This patch makes the rpc code use the global config object from
openstack-common.  Based on some recent discussions on the mailing list,
this may not be the final way configuration handling is done here, but
it is certainly better than the register_opts() hack that is removed by
this patch.

Change-Id: Id128126e0bc064a2a1c710c6bd32fb3d137dc7f6

commit_message:
Remove cinder.log usage from cinder.rpc.

Part of blueprint common-rpc.

This patch removes the usage of cinder.log from cinder.rpc.  This is
necessary before cinder.rpc can be moved to openstack-common.  The rpc
logging was not using any of the extra features provided in cinder.log as
far as I can tell, so the changes are very simple.

This is the final dependency.  After this change, the rpc code
can be moved to openstack-common without any changes.

Change-Id: I17ca4b691bb8d4f18e618632a2381dd12d31852a

commit_message:
Remove cinder.context dependency from cinder.rpc

Part of blueprint common-rpc.

This patch removes the usage of cinder.context from cinder.rpc.  Everything
needed to implement RpcContext now exists within cinder.rpc.

Change-Id: I9e6ec0d22e55d3d4f38e12e0fdd2df745da496f5

commit_message:
Localize rpc options to rpc code.

Part of blueprint common-rpc.

Move rpc options from cinder.flags into cinder.rpc code.  This is necessary
before the rpc code can be moved to openstack-common.

Change-Id: I474c3660e1cbd3ab663571b1e088c84deb905e0b

Part of blueprint versioned-rpc-apis.

One side effect of this change was that cinder.scheduler.api was removed
in favor of cinder.scheduler.rpcapi.  In this case, the api was just a
direct wrapper around rpc usage.  For other APIs, I've been following
the pattern that the rpcapi module provides the rpc client wrapper, and

commit_message:
Add version to scheduler rpc API.

Part of blueprint versioned-rpc-apis.

One side effect of this change was that cinder.scheduler.api was removed
in favor of cinder.scheduler.rpcapi.  In this case, the api was just a
direct wrapper around rpc usage.  For other APIs, I've been following
the pattern that the rpcapi module provides the rpc client wrapper, and
if any other client-side logic is needed, that's where an api module is
used.

Change-Id: Ibd0292936f9afc77aeb5d040660bfa857861eed1

commit_message:
Sync cfg and iniparser from openstack-common.

Cherry picks af387b9, cb6bf34 and c6c29ab from Nova.

This change pulls in the latest version of the cfg module from
openstack-common includes some formatting changes, spelling fixes,
support for bol/eol spaces in values and support for deprecated
options.

Change-Id: I58c7b2100b594f5f261c089d674f449a1a7d067b

commit_message:
Use cfg's new global CONF object

Cherry picks 00786bc from Nova.

Implements blueprint cfg-global-object

Replace cinder.flags.FLAGS with openstack.common.cfg.CONF.

In future, we can do a s/FLAGS/CONF/ across the codebase.

Change-Id: If213a4a5da1faf96aac82f34b18d1e0b061495c0

commit_message:
Use rpc from openstack-common.

Final patch for blueprint common-rpc.

This patch removes cinder.rpc in favor of the copy in openstack-common.

Change-Id: I9c2f6bdbe8cd0c44417f75284131dbf3c126d1dd

commit_message:
Make use of openstack.common.jsonutils.

This patch imports jsonutils from openstack-common.  It removes the
equivalent code from cinder.utils and then converts the code base to use
jsonutils.  The primary motivator for this change was to remove the rest
of the dependencies from cinder.rpc on cinder.utils.

Change-Id: I4b16577f774194a628bf84d5352e63ec1f868698

commit_message:
Don't use pbr for pbr.

It turns out, that when you setup_requires pbr from another package, it gets
installed via easy_install instead of via pip. easy_install, craptastic
pile of vomit and excrement that it is, can't manage to process the entry
points in the package it's installing while installing it, so you always
wind up with pbr version=="". Sigh.

Change-Id: Ib2b8e77662286fd4f86e9ccc55680cccc8ce349b

commit_message:
Convert Cinder to use openstack-common jsonutils.

This patch replaces json handling code in Cinder with openstack-common
jsonutils.  Also remove some unused imports.

Implement blueprint cinder-common-jsonutils

Change-Id: I28c1a095823c2f04f30c32724144297a2d67fba4
Reviewed-on: https://review.openstack.org/9912
Reviewed-by: Mark McLoughlin <markmc@redhat.com>
Reviewed-by: Vish Ishaya <vishvananda@gmail.com>
Approved: John Griffith <john.griffith@solidfire.com>
Tested-by: Jenkins

commit_message:
Add missing ack to impl_qpid.

Fix bug 1012374.

Johannes Erdfelt pointed out that impl_qpid wasn't acking messages that
it received.  This turned out to be a nasty oversight, resulting in
unbounded message queue growth inside of the python-qpid library.  This
fixes it.

Change-Id: I0370293807f0282e1dbdd59246f70be031e888a9
Reviewed-on: https://review.openstack.org/9908
Reviewed-by: Vish Ishaya <vishvananda@gmail.com>
Approved: John Griffith <john.griffith@solidfire.com>
Tested-by: Jenkins

commit_message:
Move queue_get_for() from db to rpc.

Part of blueprint common-rpc.

The function queue_get_for() is a utility function used by various
consumers of the rpc API.  This function lived in the db API, but never
ended up using anything from the database.  This patch moves it into the
rpc API so that it can be used by other users of rpc once it moves into
openstack-common.

Change-Id: If92675beecff5471b416a929c161b810e3c71939
Reviewed-on: https://review.openstack.org/9906
Reviewed-by: Vish Ishaya <vishvananda@gmail.com>
Approved: John Griffith <john.griffith@solidfire.com>
Tested-by: Jenkins

commit_message:
Sync with latest version of openstack.common.cfg

Cherry picks c1bf456 from Nova.

Changes since last sync:

 - Alphabetize imports in openstack/common/cfg.py
 - make reset() clear defaults and overrides
 - automatically create option groups
 - allow options to be marked as required
 - use a list comprehension instead of map()

Change-Id: Ie17fe855a75b5021b031902aa86031d8ddc06dfd
Reviewed-on: https://review.openstack.org/9867
Approved: James E. Blair <corvus@inaugust.com>
Reviewed-by: James E. Blair <corvus@inaugust.com>
Tested-by: James E. Blair <corvus@inaugust.com>

commit_message:
Add base support for rpc API versioning.

Part of blueprint versioned-rpc-apis.

This commit includes the base support for versioned RPC APIs.  It
introduces the RpcProxy and RpcDispatcher classes that have common code
for handling versioning on the client and server sides, respectively.

RPC APIs will be converted one at a time using this infrastructure.

Change-Id: I07bd82e9ff60c356123950e466caaffdfce79eba
Reviewed-on: https://review.openstack.org/9901
Reviewed-by: Huang Zhiteng <zhiteng.huang@intel.com>
Reviewed-by: Vish Ishaya <vishvananda@gmail.com>
Approved: John Griffith <john.griffith@solidfire.com>
Tested-by: Jenkins

commit_message:
Make kombu support optional for running unit tests.

Fix bug 838386.

Previously, the unit tests required kombu to be installed to run.  This
patch makes it so the unit tests will still complete successfully, even
if kombu is not installed.

Change-Id: I06831a37f8c857bbfd0bce1b1c3aeda7d341a589
Reviewed-on: https://review.openstack.org/9900
Reviewed-by: Vish Ishaya <vishvananda@gmail.com>
Approved: John Griffith <john.griffith@solidfire.com>
Tested-by: Jenkins

commit_message:
Stop using cinder.exception from cinder.rpc.

This patch is a part of continuing to remove dependencies from cinder.rpc
on the rest of cinder.  One RPC related exception was defined in
cinder.exception, so that was moved to cinder.rpc.common where the rest of
them live.  These exceptions were changed to no longer use CinderException
as their base.  Instead, there is a new RPCException base.

One other change that should be reviewed closely is the removal of using
cinder.exception.wrap_exception() in cinder.rpc.amqp.  As far as I can tell,
this didn't actually do anything since nothing was being passed in to
wrap_exception().

Change-Id: I36ff7c05ab0467ad8506b56d561c532eadf8dff8
Reviewed-on: https://review.openstack.org/9899
Reviewed-by: Vish Ishaya <vishvananda@gmail.com>
Approved: John Griffith <john.griffith@solidfire.com>
Tested-by: Jenkins

commit_message:
Remove 'cinder-manage config convert'

This convers the old flagfile style config files into the the
new .ini style config files. Since Cinder is new and it's first
release will only support .ini style files there's no need for
such a command.

Change-Id: Ie2f4cd8b6f5fc66547a59d39aa3d5eb896b1ddf4
Reviewed-on: https://review.openstack.org/9871
Reviewed-by: Huang Zhiteng <zhiteng.huang@intel.com>
Reviewed-by: Vish Ishaya <vishvananda@gmail.com>
Approved: John Griffith <john.griffith@solidfire.com>
Tested-by: Jenkins

commit_message:
Use _lookup_by_name instead of _conn.lookupByName

use the helper function instead of the libvirt call directly
to allow NovaExceptions instead of libvirt exceptions to be thrown.

Change-Id: Ieac171e1a2bce1f5542ae73f3d8f6b7a5ccfa8f7

commit_message:
convert to float instead of int in the watch rule

as the data sent from the guests are likely to be floats.

Change-Id: Ice17c23997150db8c52c50767ed94fce8b182d4b
Signed-off-by: Angus Salkeld <asalkeld@redhat.com>

I would love to see unit tests too, but in our current state we have no tests that exercise the db only. The current test framework goes through the API router, where ids are never passed to the plugin.'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2012-07-19 10:17:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

hi,
I don't know how this work in the current codes. You know our api does not allow pass in the uuid value to post and put.

In addition, we need test cases.

Thanks"}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2012-07-19 10:17:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Thanks for the clarification. Adding test cases will be a chunk of sugar.'}, {'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2012-07-19 10:17:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2012-07-19 10:17:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Hi gongysh, 

This allows a plugin to specify an id rather than getting it from the db base class. 

For example: 

network['network']['id'] = MY_UUID
return super(NvpPlugin, self).create_network(context, network)"}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-07-19 10:17:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Hi,
I know that this is afetr the fact, but the UUID checks do not need to be done here. They are defined in the global checks.

For example:

    'networks': {
        'id': {'allow_post': False, 'allow_put': False,
               'validate': {'type:regex': UUID_PATTERN}},

This ensures that the UUID has to be a valid on if it is defined.
Please look at https://review.openstack.org/10011
Thanks
Gary"}]

commit_message:
Misused and not used config options

Cherry picks dc9c3cb from Nova.

Fixes bug #1000071

[nova.api.sizelimit.py]
osapi_max_request_body_size: BoolOpt -> IntOpt

[nova.rpc.__init__.py]
allowed_rpc_exception_modules: IntOpt -> ListOpt

[nova.volume.driver.py]
num_shell_tries: StrOpt -> IntOpt
num_iscsi_scan_tries: StrOpt -> IntOpt

[nova.volume.driver.py]
san_thin_provision: 'true' -> True
san_is_local: 'false' -> False

Change-Id: If283dd7c4feba69c07bd483acd14f45c2659b743

Others: please review this and prevent from being auto-abandoned by Gerrit due to inactivity.'}, {'account_id': 1228, 'date': '2012-04-19 22:10:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Looks good to me - ran tests and passed and functional test worked too (see below). I am wondering if we shouldn't hardcode max-length in clean.py and instead pull from XSD that defines contract length... may make such things more visible to implementors. - my 2 cents

XSD length description described here (but not in current identity XSDs): http://www.w3schools.com/schema/schema_facets.asp

Current identity XSDs stored here: https://github.com/openstack/identity-api/tree/master/openstack-identity-api/src/docbkx/common/xsd

functional test:

keystone user-create --name waytoomanycharactersinthisverylongnameshouldreturnameaningfulerrorindicatingthatthenameiswaytoolong --pass Pass123

No handlers could be found for logger "keystoneclient.client"
User name should not be greater than 64 characters. (HTTP 400)'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2012-04-19 22:56:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Looks like an incomplete patch to me.

- clean_tenant_name is not applied to either create_tenant or update_tenant.
- role name is also limited to 64 characters in identity.backends.sql
- Every other sql backend has similar constraints that should be validated as part of this patch
- I'm tempted to say that if value.strip() != value a 400 should be thrown (if we're even worried about this), instead of the data being silently changed"}, {'account_id': 1633, 'date': '2012-04-24 10:36:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Added user name validation. Fixes bug 966251.

1. Verified name length while creating/updating user.
2. Disallowed blank user name in create/update.
3. Added unit test coverage.

Change-Id: I60c6cd4b772652ed5212d70aabc0577d89e1c952

commit_message:
Add documentation for recently added os-used-limits extension.

The os-used-limits extension adds information for limits that have been used so
far to the /limits GET response.

The ext was added in this patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/9544/

Change-Id: I8bdb1b9ebdbc4b92a8e9a3143e8ed5d4724ac264

subject: add glance bash-completion
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-06-28 08:54:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build successful

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-python-glanceclient-merge/67/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-python-glanceclient-pep8/52/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-python-glanceclient-python26/50/testReport : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-python-glanceclient-python27/51/testReport : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-integration-tests-devstack-vm/6670/consoleFull : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-07-03 18:00:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Do not merge

I don't like how much code is being added to do so little. I'd prefer not to hack this in right now and wait until we can get what feels like a more complete solution to the generic tab completion problem."}, {'account_id': 4200, 'date': '2012-07-04 07:54:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

This is exactly how bash-completion is implemented in python-novaclient and is already (core-)reviewed for python-keystoneclient.

I was asked to use a new subcommand to fetch the completion commands insted of parsing the help output.
If you would prefer the (hackish) help-parsing solution, please refer to
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/7870/

I don't see your point at all. Why does this code work for everyone (nova & keystone) but you?

What part of this solution do you regard as incomplete?"}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-07-04 17:05:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Ok, so the things that come to mind immediately are:

1) I don't want to see 'bash-completion' in the help output. It's not useful for anything other than something that should happen behind the scenes.

2) Just because one project adopts a piece of code, other projects aren't required to blindly accept it.

3) This is rather selfish, but I don't use bash. So, this doesn't work for me. This is why I'm asking for more of a 'complete' solution to tab completion. I'm not interested in a solution that works only for bash.

4) You haven't filed a bug or blueprint so we can track this in LaunchPad, and your commit message isn't giving enough detail as to represent the change you're making.

5) This only solves the completion problem for commands and options. It would be even more useful to tab-complete entity names and ids.

Don't get me wrong, I would love to have tab completion in glanceclient. However, we need to do it correctly."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-07-19 06:03:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-07-19 06:03:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

commit_message:
Ensures policy file is reloaded only if updated.

Fixes bug 1023649

The fix is 'inspired' (ie: copied) from nova. It is cached in memory unless a
change in policy file is detected. In that case, a reload is triggered.

This patch also adds a set of unit tests for quantum/policy.py, which was
previously not covered.

Change-Id: I337042ae418b518268acd30c26ef02559887a8be

hi,
In fact I use -H for quantum and preserve -h for subcommand.
As far, I found no easy way to use double -h.
Before this change, I use
quantum -H to print quantum usage
quantum port-list -h to print port-list usage.

So if we need to fix this inconsistency, we have to find a way to use double -h, which is meaning 
quantum -h to print quantum usage
quantum port-list -h to print port-list usage.'}]

commit_message:
Use -h, --help to show help messages.

Fixes bug 1023260
"quantumv2" command used '-H' and '--Help' to show help messages,
but it is inconsistent to the convention of option names used in
other OpenStack client lib commands. This commit fixes it.

Change-Id: I85c1e79c2cd08bcc0112ed2f10ca8210e9384687

commit_message:
Raise NotImplementedError, not NotImplemented singleton

NotImplementedError is for exceptions, NotImplemented is an error
singleton

Change-Id: I2bc42783c5bb92a32d7c3b0f5efab32a2e2f8fb6

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-07-09 14:27:00.000000000', 'message': "Partially implements blueprint xenapi-live-migration

This is dependent on refactoring of libvirt live migration.

Enables live migration using xenapi:
* works when both hosts are part of the same aggregate
* assumes shared storage is configured as the default SR

Limitations in this version:
* only works for images that don't have an external
  ramdisk/kernel

Change-Id: I74fc6aae9a615be7cefb1cf07755764df1af957a

commit_message:
Partially implements blueprint xenapi-live-migration

This is dependent on refactoring of libvirt live migration.

Enables live migration using xenapi:
* works when both hosts are part of the same aggregate
* assumes shared storage is configured as the default SR

Limitations in this version:
* only works for images that don't have an external
  ramdisk/kernel

Change-Id: I74fc6aae9a615be7cefb1cf07755764df1af957a

Joe: The same functionality is in the SameHostFilter but that is only for the OpenStack API.

This code would still be required if using the EC2 API right?'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-07-18 02:49:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

commit_message:
Rename get_lock() to _get_lock().

This patch changes get_lock() to _get_lock() in the compute manager.
This method is not used via rpc, so this name change helps clarify that
it is (at least currently) an internal-only function.  Marking it as
such allows the method signature to be changed without updating the RPC
API version and having to maintain backwards compatibility.

Related to blueprint no-db-messaging.

Change-Id: Ib608ba06215e0ab8be23cbd32c284420b5230dba

commit_message:
Distinguish over-quota for volume size and number.

Fixes LP 1020634

Ensure that exceeding the allowed number of volumes is not
mis-represented in log messages and exception handling as
excessive space usage.

Change-Id: I71ec995c77bc447bfc9221084b057bd8d69a4513

We don't actually setup require pbr.

This causes CRAZY infinite recursion problems. I think.

commit_message:
Replace example.com with localhost for some tests

Fix for LP Bug #1025756.

When running the unit tests on a system without a
direct internet connection some tests run slowly.
Replacing example.com with localhost:0 speeds up
the relevant tests.

Change-Id: Iac6fc506b1d36b18ab21bb956ec2d8acc004bba8

[{'created': '2012-07-18 19:25:40.000000000', 'message': "Make sure we supply the config file to glance-manage

Without supplying the --config-file arg to glance-manage,
by default glance-manage defaults to look in /etc/glance/
for a config file. We don't want that -- we want to supply
the config file generated by stack.sh.

Change-Id: I85ff413fd3276e99040cc407715a04f8b65e31d6
"}]
commit_message:
Make sure we supply the config file to glance-manage

Without supplying the --config-file arg to glance-manage,
by default glance-manage defaults to look in /etc/glance/
for a config file. We don't want that -- we want to supply
the config file generated by stack.sh.

Change-Id: I85ff413fd3276e99040cc407715a04f8b65e31d6

commit_message:
Display key_name only if keypairs extension is used

GET /servers/xxx will display the key_name only if the keypairs extension is
being used.

Fixes bug 1024986

commit_message:
Update info.sh

* Works properly on Fedora 17 now, possibly other RPM-based distros
* Add GetDistro() function taken from logic in stack.sh
* Source functions in tools/info.sh
* Use GetDistro() and get_packages() in tools/info.sh
* Report all installed pips
* Don't sort localrc output as order is important

Change-Id: I1b3e48e94786378c7313a0a6bea88d5cf9d0f0c0

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-07-18 16:38:58.000000000', 'message': "Match path_info in image cache middleware

The url matching code in the image cache middleware should only look at
the unconsumed path, not the full path. Webob denotes this by using
'path_info' instead of 'path.'

This also adds some tests for the version negotiation middleware to ensure
it is returning a sane path for the image cache middleware to match.

Fixes bug 1026222

Change-Id: I522e2210e2b7272f9bb47602510a2910fa193415
"}]
commit_message:
Match path_info in image cache middleware

The url matching code in the image cache middleware should only look at
the unconsumed path, not the full path. Webob denotes this by using
'path_info' instead of 'path.'

This also adds some tests for the version negotiation middleware to ensure
it is returning a sane path for the image cache middleware to match.

Fixes bug 1026222

Change-Id: I522e2210e2b7272f9bb47602510a2910fa193415

commit_message:
Convert Cinder to use openstack-common timeutils

This patch is part of effort to get Cinder to use openstack-common
package.  This part is to replace time related functions in utils.py
with 'timeutils' module.

Implement blueprint cinder-common-timeutils

Change-Id: Ic5e9e317a95a7399f0604823eec76b3642a0c1b1

commit_message:
Sync to newer openstack.common.cfg

Cherry picks e0d891e from Nova.

Changes since last sync are:

 * New ConfigOpts.find_file() for locating conf files
 * Support for directory source of config files
 * Provide file extension when when looking for files
 * Some refactoring of the cfg cache
 * Add caching to openstack.common.cfg

Change-Id: If9852d0431093d590252bb704e934a4a56ef0263

commit_message:
Add validity checks to Quantum v2 resources

Fixes bug 1015148

The code enable defining validity checks for input variables. This
is done via callback functions per type. The following types are supported:
    - type:values - checks that data is valid according to a list of values
    - type:mac_address - checks that data is a valid mac address
    - type:ip_address - checks that data is a valid ip address
    - type:subnet - checks that data is a valid cidr
    - type:regex - checks that data matches a regular expression (for
      example checking UUID validity)

Change-Id: Iaa694cbfe3c518a5cd3951271853fe986106e7f5

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-07-12 18:37:05.000000000', 'message': 'Support EC2 CreateImage API for boot-from-volume

Fixes bug lp 988335

For fidelity with AWS, where the EC2 CreateImage API is only
supported for EBS-backed instances, we now support this API
for booted-from-volume nova servers.

We create a "place-holder" image in glance with the image data
being effectively empty, and the following properties set:

  * the imaged instance's kernel and ramdisk IDs
  * block device mapping containing the appropriate snapshot ID(s)

so that we can boot from this image without providing additional
context (such as via the nova boot --block-device-mapping option)

Change-Id: I0b3d18d7922f2ad1bc687fa88e2f5d4cf5aa068b

commit_message:
Support EC2 CreateImage API for boot-from-volume

Fixes bug lp 988335

For fidelity with AWS, where the EC2 CreateImage API is only
supported for EBS-backed instances, we now support this API
for booted-from-volume nova servers.

We create a "place-holder" image in glance with the image data
being effectively empty, and the following properties set:

  * the imaged instance's kernel and ramdisk IDs
  * block device mapping containing the appropriate snapshot ID(s)

so that we can boot from this image without providing additional
context (such as via the nova boot --block-device-mapping option)

Change-Id: I0b3d18d7922f2ad1bc687fa88e2f5d4cf5aa068b

[{'account_id': 100, 'date': '2012-07-05 18:15:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

Won't this log that message every time the loop is run for drivers that haven't implemented that method?

Wouldn't there be other bigger problems if the driver is misconfigured (like nothing else working?). I'm a little skeptical this is the best way of determine that a driver import was wrong."}, {'account_id': 706, 'date': '2012-07-05 18:17:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Thanks for this, only thing I might suggest is for the log message to say something like:

msg = _("%s does not support get_all_bw_usage") % self.driver.__class__)

Also, I don't think a #NOTE is required here, the code should be pretty self-explanatory.

Thanks again!'}, {'account_id': 1711, 'date': '2012-07-05 18:19:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

The debug message doesn't say anything about get_all_bw_usage not implemented. I'd prefer it's more informative."}, {'account_id': 706, 'date': '2012-07-05 18:22:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Agree with Johannes and Brian: logging this every time the timer expires seems excessive. Especially this seems to be a xenapi only feature. Moving to __init__ also seems questionable because I'm not sure what parameters to give to call the driver. Is there a way to just log once at warning level? A global variable would work but a bit ugly."}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-07-13 17:47:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

So, I agree that there should be some mechanism so that this log message is not generated every time through the periodic task; otherwise, the logs are going to be *full* of the message.  Further, do you mean this to be DEBUG-level?  I'd rather see a message of this sort be WARNING-level, if it's meant to alert the operator to a misconfiguration; under most operational circumstances, DEBUG-level messages will simply be discarded (while still incurring a CPU cost from the log message generation)."}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-07-18 12:16:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

The issue here seems to be that if there is a mis-configuration, you get a bunch of NotImplemented errors and it's hard to figure out which driver was loaded

Brian made a good suggestion:

  can you move this to the manager init method so at least we can know what driver is loaded when the compute manager starts up?

i.e. in ComputeManager.__init__ we should log an INFO message about which driver we're loading e.g.

  LOG.info(_("Loading compute driver '%s'") % compute_driver)
  try:
      self.driver = ...

Also, Nikhil - please read this overview on good git commit practice:

https://lists.launchpad.net/openstack/msg13742.html

Your commit message could be a little more detailed and easier to understand.'}, {'account_id': 2537, 'date': '2012-07-18 14:58:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 2537, 'date': '2012-07-18 15:02:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-07-18 15:11:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

commit_message:
Info log to see which compute driver has loaded

Adding this log will help keep track if the
intended compute driver has loaded or it has been
misconfigured.

fixes bug 1021417

Change-Id: I6fd9e3b45aad36056882e8cef12b90bb8d7aea7b

commit_message:
Use openstack.common.log to log request id

* Log request id from the request context for glance-api
  and glance-registry
* Further integrate with the common log module by storing RequestContext
  objects in thread-local storage so loggers can acces their attributes
* Move request id formatting into the request module so it appears with
  the preferred prefix (req-) in logs
* Implement bp glance-request-tracking

Change-Id: I2095ad16fef6b4bc8e49229c9f0326da8c743ff7

commit_message:
Fixes XenAPI driver import in vm_vdi_cleaner

xenapi/connection.py was renamed xenapi/driver.py, it appears, but
vm_vdi_cleaner was not updated.

Also removed unused optparse import.

Fixes bug 1025912

Change-Id: Ia1a93400dc24455fe91fdf4283eb32bcca4037cf

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-07-10 19:52:46.000000000', 'message': "fix libvirt get_memory_mb_total() with xen

Commit 5b93a576 failed to remove the 'staticmethod'
decorator from the method, to allow it to access
object variables.

Also there is no need to have the libvirt getInfo() call
be xen specific.  In the LXC/QEMU/UML drivers this call
uses GNULIB's physmem module, which is cross-OS portable.

Change-Id: I565eda78f6c468cf6bd227756cfc068725069218
(cherry picked from commit 78352b98a96946145bec9010872d8f2769691ac2)
"}, {'created': '2012-07-10 20:27:34.000000000', 'message': "fix libvirt get_memory_mb_total() with xen

Fixes bug 1004298 in stable/essex.

Commit 5b93a576 failed to remove the 'staticmethod'
decorator from the method, to allow it to access
object variables.

Also there is no need to have the libvirt getInfo() call
be xen specific.  In the LXC/QEMU/UML drivers this call
uses GNULIB's physmem module, which is cross-OS portable.

Change-Id: I565eda78f6c468cf6bd227756cfc068725069218
(cherry picked from commit 78352b98a96946145bec9010872d8f2769691ac2)
"}]
commit_message:
fix libvirt get_memory_mb_total() with xen

Fixes bug 1004298 in stable/essex.

Commit 5b93a576 failed to remove the 'staticmethod'
decorator from the method, to allow it to access
object variables.

Also there is no need to have the libvirt getInfo() call
be xen specific.  In the LXC/QEMU/UML drivers this call
uses GNULIB's physmem module, which is cross-OS portable.

Change-Id: I565eda78f6c468cf6bd227756cfc068725069218
(cherry picked from commit 78352b98a96946145bec9010872d8f2769691ac2)

With it, we can use eventlet as our wsgi server again.

"}]
commit_message:
Use eventlet's wsgi again

Ref #55

This adds a monkey patch for the eventlet's maximum url length issue (ref #18).
With it, we can use eventlet as our wsgi server again.

Once Eventlet releases a new version (the fix is already in master) we'll drop
the monkey patch and set the limit proper.

Change-Id: Ia122af8d53b49587ade0ead6897fdd10107f4a87
Signed-off-by: Tomas Sedovic <tomas@sedovic.cz>

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-07-01 09:33:40.000000000', 'message': 'Make metadata content match the requested version of the metadata API.

Currently the same metadata is returned no matter what metadata
version is requested. Metadata is currently implemented to version
2009-04-04 (more or less) as defined here:
http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/instancedata-data-categories.html

This change adds version checking conditionals throughout
get_ec2_metadata and only includes the metadata if the requested version
should contain it.

get_ec2_metadata has also been reordered so that data is added oldest to
newest by API version. In a future change I may attempt to add
unimplemented API versions (2011-01-01, 2012-06-01).

Change-Id: Ibf6e6e3b9807f29dccd31006515df550bf9bf57b
'}, {'created': '2012-07-01 21:28:08.000000000', 'message': "Make metadata content match the requested version of the metadata API.

Currently the same metadata is returned no matter what metadata
version is requested. Metadata is currently implemented to version
2009-04-04 (apart from existing TODOs) as defined here:
http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/instancedata-data-categories.html

This change adds version checking conditionals throughout
get_ec2_metadata and only includes the metadata if the requested version
should contain it.

When there is a difference between Amazon API implementation and documentation
I've gone with replicating the implementation. So far differences include:
- undocumented hostname introduced in 1.0, deprecated in favour of
  local-hostname
- kernel-id and ramdisk-id seem have to been implemented in 2007-12-15,
  not 2008-02-01 as documented

get_ec2_metadata has also been reordered so that data is added oldest to
newest by API version. In a future change I may attempt to add
unimplemented API versions (2011-01-01, 2012-06-01).

Change-Id: Ibf6e6e3b9807f29dccd31006515df550bf9bf57b
"}]
commit_message:
Make metadata content match the requested version of the metadata API.

Currently the same metadata is returned no matter what metadata
version is requested. Metadata is currently implemented to version
2009-04-04 (apart from existing TODOs) as defined here:
http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/instancedata-data-categories.html

This change adds version checking conditionals throughout
get_ec2_metadata and only includes the metadata if the requested version
should contain it.

When there is a difference between Amazon API implementation and documentation
I've gone with replicating the implementation. So far differences include:
- undocumented hostname introduced in 1.0, deprecated in favour of
  local-hostname
- kernel-id and ramdisk-id seem have to been implemented in 2007-12-15,
  not 2008-02-01 as documented

get_ec2_metadata has also been reordered so that data is added oldest to
newest by API version. In a future change I may attempt to add
unimplemented API versions (2011-01-01, 2012-06-01).

Change-Id: Ibf6e6e3b9807f29dccd31006515df550bf9bf57b

[{'created': '2012-07-16 17:51:43.000000000', 'message': "Sync jsonutils from openstack-common.

In addition to the following changes from openstack-common, this patch
includes some tweak to nova unit tests.  timeutils.strtime() will raise
an exception if the year in a datetime object is before 1900.

Changes from openstack-common:

    commit ce3071437d1871f77c4d8573cbe5f4ea8c817650
    Author: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>
    Date:   Mon Jul 16 10:30:25 2012 -0400

        Use strtime() in to_primitive() for datetime objs.

        This patch updates jsonutils.to_primitive() to use timeutils.strtime()
        to convert a datimetime object to a string instead of just using str().
        This ensures that we can easily convert the string back to a datetime
        using timeutils.parse_strtime().

        Required for the nova blueprint no-db-messaging.

    commit 4c9d439ef24f5afdd74aa9153aa8fc772051e6cb
    Author: Tim Daly Jr <timjr@yahoo-inc.com>
    Date:   Tue Jun 26 02:48:42 2012 +0000

        Add 'filedecoder' method to the jsonutils wrapper module.

        Fixes bug #1017765

        After version 3.3.2, the anyjson library will throw a KeyError if
        filedecoder isn't present.  The filedecoder is just like the decoder
        except it takes a file instead of a string, like json.load() instead
        of json.loads().

Change-Id: Ib51f0da8641c035371e09047de9abe3cb83203e9
"}]
commit_message:
Sync jsonutils from openstack-common.

In addition to the following changes from openstack-common, this patch
includes some tweak to nova unit tests.  timeutils.strtime() will raise
an exception if the year in a datetime object is before 1900.

Changes from openstack-common:

    commit ce3071437d1871f77c4d8573cbe5f4ea8c817650
    Author: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>
    Date:   Mon Jul 16 10:30:25 2012 -0400

        Use strtime() in to_primitive() for datetime objs.

        This patch updates jsonutils.to_primitive() to use timeutils.strtime()
        to convert a datimetime object to a string instead of just using str().
        This ensures that we can easily convert the string back to a datetime
        using timeutils.parse_strtime().

        Required for the nova blueprint no-db-messaging.

    commit 4c9d439ef24f5afdd74aa9153aa8fc772051e6cb
    Author: Tim Daly Jr <timjr@yahoo-inc.com>
    Date:   Tue Jun 26 02:48:42 2012 +0000

        Add 'filedecoder' method to the jsonutils wrapper module.

        Fixes bug #1017765

        After version 3.3.2, the anyjson library will throw a KeyError if
        filedecoder isn't present.  The filedecoder is just like the decoder
        except it takes a file instead of a string, like json.load() instead
        of json.loads().

Change-Id: Ib51f0da8641c035371e09047de9abe3cb83203e9

commit_message:
Don't setup swift3 if it's not being used.

"setup_develop" was still being called for swift3, even if it's
not in enabled services.  This wraps that call in an
"is_service_enbled" conditional so that stack.sh doesn't attempt
to set it up if it's not enabled.

- Fixes bug 1021150.

Change-Id: I26ed1a1e73eee24da78580eda3b13e5d3eb65361

If the code for the Context class cannot be reused, then extending it in our own Context does not make a lot of sense, as we're basically redefining the whole behaviour of the base class.  We should consider whether that module should not be imported at all, unless we look at how it can be extended without re-defining everything.

For instance our context defines an attribute called "read_deleted", while the openstack-common context defines an attribute called "show_deleted". They appear to be semantically identical, can't just we use show_deleted as well?

On another note, would it be possible to have to_dict invoke the method from the base class and then extend the returned dict to add attributes specific for Qauntum (if any?).

For get_admin_context, being it a module function, my gut feeling says it might not be too bad is they're redefined as they would have been imported as different objects anyway. 

The OO programmer which is in me is crying for a factory method in the context class, but I am kicking and punching him to make sure his opinion does not count.'}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-07-18 06:57:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

One issue around the use of the new context class (we could split that change out into another patch if you prefer). 

Its too bad there's no easy way to exclude all openstack common from pep8 checks... would definitely have preferred that."}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2012-07-18 06:57:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

ok, I will split the context change out from this change.
Regarding get_admin_context, I think we have no way to reuse its code, because we will have to create an instance of our own Context class. The context class in common project is not common enough for our project. we will have to derive and have our own context. The get_admin_context of the common context class creates an instance of a specific class in common, this is not common for most of the projects which use common codes.'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2012-07-18 06:57:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2012-07-18 06:57:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

After second thought, I think I prefer to keep the change of context into this change. see my inline comment, please.'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2012-07-18 06:57:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

Hi,
I just want to make sure imported common codes can work:
1. we must have the common context since it is imported by other common codes.
2. We have our own context class because the common context is not enough for our needs.
3. we had better derive our own Context from the common context due to the implementation of common context's get_context_from_function_and_args
4. the get_admin_context of common context's module is called only if we have not passed in any context to common codes' function where a context is needed. we can avoid to call this function by always passing our own context instance.
In conclude, I don't want to depend on the common context too much, which may change out of our control. Our current implementation does not use any field of common context.
That is a good choice."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-07-18 06:57:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

Build successful

Hi,
Please look at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/9166/ - most of the imports were already done here.
Thanks
Gary"}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-07-18 06:57:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Hi,
There are a number of things that are important here:
1. If we are going to use openstack-common then we should take the code from openstack common. In some cases we should address the issues first with openstack-common and then import (please see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/9201/)
2. Any reason not to move forward with https://review.openstack.org/#/c/9166/ an you add in the missing/updates files with your fix?
3. We need to understand how we can ensure that openstack-common addresses the pep8 issues and other issues that you mentioned in your mail. 
Thanks
Gary'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2012-07-18 06:57:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

gary,
I have not notified that change before. 

That change lacks my notifier part. To include notifier part, we need particular attention to pep8 and context class. It is not just a update.sh execution.
Please see what I've done in my change.

Thanks
Yong Sheng Gong"}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2012-07-18 06:57:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2012-07-18 06:57:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Gary,

Besides the pep8 issue and practice, I have said for notifier part to work in quantum or other projects, we need integrate our context class with it. To update codes from common codes involving make sure our codes can work with them. any one update from openstack common project into quantum should be responsible for the integration. I forgot to add that however, if you feel nothing should be done, I am happy to +2 and approve.

This discussion is more about ensuring all design alternatives have been considered rather than blocking other people's work."}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2012-07-18 06:57:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: (1 inline comment)

Hi, I've looked at the most recent patch and the previous comments. I saw several comments but the patch still looks pretty much the same (excluding the other openstack-common files which have been merged with a separate patch). 

However the patch has now got an approval. I just would be to make sure that all concerns have been addressed before approving. It seems it is clear that Quantum context extends the functionality of the common context, but, for instance, I cannot still understand why the Quantum context uses different variables for elements with the same semantics (look at read_deleted vs show_deleted, tenant_id vs tenant, and user_id vs user). Please note that IMHO by extending the base class those attributes are not being renamed, but duplicated."}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2012-07-18 06:57:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Following your last comment, I have looked at reasons that are forcing us to use the "common context". 

It seems you have a need to have a context object which could read both by Quantum modules (which use user_id, tenant_id and so on) and common modules (which use user, tenant and such things). 
In particular the issue seems to lie with the rabbit_notifier, which executes a get_admin_context. 

The notify_decorator also executes get_context_from_function_and_args, but that will fetch any context, not necessarily the one in quantum.openstack.common.

So now that there's a clear reason for the duplication of attributes and methods, I think it might be good we make this clear in the code as well, so that future contributors will not wonder why the code is this way.

Also, have you considered whether 
i) Quantum could just use the same naming convention as openstack.common or
ii) python properties could be used to provide 'aliases' for such properties so that the data is not actually duplicated - it's not about memory use, it's more about making sure the context does not go out of sync over time even though it should be an immutable object'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2012-07-18 06:57:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

Yong is working with openstack-common team for addressing the Context issue.
The context as it is, even if not really ideal, at least does not break things.
Approving as it would be unfair to hold up for too long other people's work."}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-07-18 06:57:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: (2 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-07-18 06:57:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: (2 inline comments)

Looks good.
2 little nits'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-07-18 06:57:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

I feel like I am between a rock and a hard place here.'}, {'account_id': 2350, 'date': '2012-07-18 06:57:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

I just have a question about the licensing. Should we keep the license year as 2011?'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2012-07-18 06:57:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2012-07-18 06:57:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Hi,
def get_context_from_function_and_args(function, args, kwargs):
        if isinstance(arg, RequestContext):
            return arg
There is a isinstance here, So I have to base our Context on the Common Context.

I have sent out an email about the common context desgin.

Even with the current setting, to refactor quantum context in a significant way is should be out of this change.

Thanks
Yong Sheng Gong'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2012-07-18 06:57:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: (2 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2012-07-18 06:57:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2012-07-18 06:57:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2012-07-18 06:57:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Regarding context:

I have said our Context class is from nova project, which is using user_id, tenant_id, but the openstack common Context class is from glance project, which is using user,tenant.

I think to ask nova to use (or base) the common context without duplication will take a lot of efforts too. With the same token, it will take some efforts to modify our Context.

For all projects to use the common context, I think we have to redesign the common Context so that it has no its own fields, just has some common methods.

On why I have to base our Context on the Common context, see my previous comments.

Thanks
Yong Sheng Gong'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2012-07-18 06:57:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

If you are referring to common code, it is out of this patch.
You can launch a change in openstack commond project.

Thanks'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-07-18 06:57:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Verified

Build successful

commit_message:
Introduce files from openstack common.

Because the openstack common project does not stick to latest pep8 rules,
I have to exclude some bad-ruled files in the tox.ini and run_tests.sh.
However pep8 does not support exclude option in the format quantum/openstack/common,
so I have to exclude some of openstack common files one by one.

Also, I have changed the Qunatum Context to base on the common context.

I does not update the setup.py in our openstack common dir and the one
under quantum top dir, since it should be maintained in a consistent way
across all of openstack projects.

After this introduction, we are ready for notification feature.

Change-Id: I2729c2dc3958835374c88d704e842e613785ec14

commit_message:
Avoid removal of attributes used by policy engine

Fixes bug1025150

Ensures that each attribute which is used by the policy engine is not
removed by the plugin when the 'fields' query parameter is specified.
This could be better achieved by not having the plugin perform this
selection, but as it is part of the plugin interface, it's probably better
not to introduce changes which alter it.

Change-Id: I68ab0998b7113f06da5df74ccd44e390640de475

commit_message:
Support running .functests against Keystonified Swift

Current development pipeline for Swift only assumes running tests
against SAIO, but I found it extremely useful to run functional
tests against actual servers.

This version requires module swiftclient, as does the rest of
Swift code now. Also, 2 small fixes were done to address review
comments.

Change-Id: I3234baeb6ef2e8c97ba97117c3df8233c4148a89

commit_message:
Enable delay_auth_decision for swift/auth_token.

- Add delay_auth_decision=1 in swift proxy configuration to allow
  anonymous access or tempurl.

Rebased

Change-Id: I6a97d0ff6d24a3ffef56d3d426683e48206eff71

  container. The presence of next links are indicators to
  continue pagination while their value drives the location of
  the next page.
* A user can pass in --page-size on the command line, or page_size
  when using the controller directly, to control how many images
  are requested with each subsequent paginated request. Default page
  size is 20.
* Add a flag (strict_url_check) for the FakeAPI class to control
  whether it chops off query params when trying to match a request
  to a fixture.
* Related to bp glance-client-v2.

Change-Id: Ib98e912a7af0bb570b4fd738733edd9b837d1a12
'}]
commit_message:
Add pagination to v2 image-list

* Use a recursive generator function to iterate over the image
  container. The presence of next links are indicators to
  continue pagination while their value drives the location of
  the next page.
* A user can pass in --page-size on the command line, or page_size
  when using the controller directly, to control how many images
  are requested with each subsequent paginated request. Default page
  size is 20.
* Add a flag (strict_url_check) for the FakeAPI class to control
  whether it chops off query params when trying to match a request
  to a fixture.
* Related to bp glance-client-v2.

Change-Id: Ib98e912a7af0bb570b4fd738733edd9b837d1a12

commit_message:
Prevent links from being printed in v2 CLI

Nobody wants to see links in a human interface. This prevents the
file, access, self and schema links from being printed when calling
image-show or explain.

Related to bp glance-client-v2

Change-Id: Ib98e912a7af0bb570b4fd738733edd9b837d1a11

commit_message:
Replace static v2 Image model with warlock model

* Add warlock v0.1.0 as a dependency
* Generate a pythonic, self-validating Image model using warlock
* Add raw method to Schema model
* Related to bp glance-client-v2

Change-Id: Ib98e912a7af0bb570b4fd738733edd9b837d1a04

parsing of the entities to look in the correct place when trying

commit_message:
Rewrite link parsing for finding v2 schemas

What we called 'links' are no longer returned in a container of
objects, they are top-level entity attribtues. This fixes the
parsing of the entities to look in the correct place when trying
to locate a specific schema.

Add a helper for printing to stderr and exiting with a non-zero
exit code.

Map 'name' to 'Attribute' when explaining a schema.

Related to bp glance-client-v2

Change-Id: Ib98e912a7af0bb570b4fd738733edd9b837d1a05

Hi,

It's great text, I'd just query the location of it in the document. Do you think this might be better in the 'troubleshooting' section, rather than "enabling-ping-and-ssh-on-vms" ?'}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-07-08 23:09:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Yeah, I struggled with where to put it. Troubleshooting section is a good idea, I'll move it."}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-07-09 00:46:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-07-09 00:47:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

This change grew in scope to refactor the networking troubleshooting section.'}, {'account_id': 612, 'date': '2012-07-10 23:09:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

oh, so when I was talking about the troubleshooting section, I was actually referring to the global one:

i.e.
http://docs.openstack.org/essex/openstack-compute/admin/content/ch_support-and-troubleshooting.html

What do you think about having troubleshooting in the one place vs in individual sections ?'}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-07-12 14:24:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

To the OpenStack doc mailing list! *spinning bat logo*'}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-07-12 14:48:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

asked about this on the shiny new mailing list, let's see what people think:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-docs/2012-July/000000.html"}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-07-13 03:47:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Based on the discussion on the mailing list, I'd like to keep this merge proposal the way it is with a networking troubleshooting section."}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-07-13 21:30:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

A couple of questions after I took a look:

Any way to address these bugs while you're in there?

commit_message:
Expand network troubleshooting section

Move troubleshooting from a subsubsection of Networking
(under floating IPs) to a subsection.

Add content about disabling reverse path filtering.

Add content about temporarily disabling firewall.

Patch set makes the xml:id="network-troubleshooting" and attempts to
address ambiguity pointed out in bug 1024321.

Change-Id: If3911b8920bddba16b72a75ba2d5a0c5b360d0ed

commit_message:
Trim token lines from requires.

setup_requires can cause pbr to be installed with easy_install, which sadly
enough is confused by comments.

Change-Id: I75407e25739b6af3c67df023e24591a6b3ad6d34

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-06-29 13:06:44.000000000', 'message': "Stop avoiding calling systemctl for tgtd on Fedora

The bug that lead to this workaround was fixed and an update is
available for Fedora:
  https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=797913

Keeping this workaround would be annoying as --skip-redirect doesn't
exist on all rpm-based distributions, and we'd have to remember using it
everywhere we interact with the tgtd service.

Change-Id: I22a5d4fe154ea04bd35d89db6d63734b5bd405aa
"}]
commit_message:
Stop avoiding calling systemctl for tgtd on Fedora

The bug that lead to this workaround was fixed and an update is
available for Fedora:
  https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=797913

Keeping this workaround would be annoying as --skip-redirect doesn't
exist on all rpm-based distributions, and we'd have to remember using it
everywhere we interact with the tgtd service.

Change-Id: I22a5d4fe154ea04bd35d89db6d63734b5bd405aa

subject: Avoid bad state in api.py when start/stop/reboot actions fail
messages:
[{'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2012-07-17 17:03:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Note that I know this is likely to be a little controversial, given the change from cast -> call. If there is a better way to avoid this brokenness, let me know.'}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2012-07-17 17:15:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I'd rather this was not made synchronous.

Why not have the compute manager change the task_state on success? This would be the proper pattern for asynchronous behavior. If the concern is that we'd be adding more database access to the compute hosts, then we could have this implemented as a call back to the scheduler. Any scheduler would do, so the message could be cast to the general "scheduler" topic.'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-07-17 17:19:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

If these changes were to be made, there is some RPC API versioning changes that need to be done.  However, I think the bigger issue is what Eric already mentioned.  These operations can take a long time, so just making them synchronous isn't going to work."}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2012-07-17 17:22:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

But, we don't want the manager to be changing the task_state directly, in preparation for no-db-compute, right?"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-07-17 17:27:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-merge/4820/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-docs/699/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-pep8/6011/consoleFull : SUCCESS
