- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-python27/2221/testReport : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/4005/testReport : FAILURE
"}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2012-07-17 17:42:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Dan,

Thus my note that another service (likely scheduler) could do the database updates, if no-db-compute is a concern.

I personally feel we should move closer to a pure actor model, rather than away from it. That might mean we need to add security mechanisms, but that is a fixable and forward path, while moving to synchronous calls would put us down a backwards path away from performance and scalability.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2012-07-17 17:48:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Yep, I didn't word my response well.. I was hoping for some direction from Russell about the best place for the recipient of the call back to live. A lot of these database accesses are going to need to be offloaded from compute, and I imagine there's a sane default for where those will land."}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-07-17 18:05:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

As far as no-db-compute stuff goes, this is just another drop in the bucket.  I wouldn't worry about it right now.  There are no patches in progress to remove the database updates from the nova-compute service.  They will need to get changed eventually, but whatever you added here would just get addressed the same was as the rest when that time comes."}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2012-07-17 18:07:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

"}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2012-07-17 18:10:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2012-07-17 17:01:22.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid bad state in api.py when start/stop/reboot actions fail

Right now, the task_state logic in compute/api.py is broken, such
that instances can get stuck in an uneditable state if a start, stop,
or reboot action is performed that fails. The easiest way to reproduce
this is with admin locking, such as:

1. nova boot .... foo
2. nova lock foo (as admin)
3. nova stop foo (as user)
4. nova unlock foo (as admin)
5. nova stop foo (as either) -> fails due to task_state==stopping
6. nova start foo (as either) -> fails due to vm_state==active

The only way out of it is to delete the instance or hack the database.

The root cause is that stop, reboot, (and sometimes start) are
cast'd through RPC, and the task_state is updated without regard
to whether these operations failed or succeeded. This patch changes
those operations to always be call'd through RPC, and the task_state
is only updated on success. This prevents the user or admin from
getting stuck in a situation such as the above.

Note the change in the api.py::check_instance_state() decorator,
which fixes a related/dependent issue of not properly ignoring
task_state when called with None. The None gets cast to set([None]),
which doesn't match "is None" and thus isn't properly ignored.

Fixes bug 1025722

Change-Id: I3383da29312aef210ae41bfc3c0368afa37773a2
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid bad state in api.py when start/stop/reboot actions fail

Right now, the task_state logic in compute/api.py is broken, such
that instances can get stuck in an uneditable state if a start, stop,
or reboot action is performed that fails. The easiest way to reproduce
this is with admin locking, such as:

1. nova boot .... foo
2. nova lock foo (as admin)
3. nova stop foo (as user)
4. nova unlock foo (as admin)
5. nova stop foo (as either) -> fails due to task_state==stopping
6. nova start foo (as either) -> fails due to vm_state==active

The only way out of it is to delete the instance or hack the database.

The root cause is that stop, reboot, (and sometimes start) are
cast'd through RPC, and the task_state is updated without regard
to whether these operations failed or succeeded. This patch changes
those operations to always be call'd through RPC, and the task_state
is only updated on success. This prevents the user or admin from
getting stuck in a situation such as the above.

Note the change in the api.py::check_instance_state() decorator,
which fixes a related/dependent issue of not properly ignoring
task_state when called with None. The None gets cast to set([None]),
which doesn't match "is None" and thus isn't properly ignored.

Fixes bug 1025722

Change-Id: I3383da29312aef210ae41bfc3c0368afa37773a2

commit_message:
Start tgtd service after installing the rpm

The later call to tgtadm needs the daemon to be running, and the rpm
package doesn't start it.

Rebased and add a corresponding change for cinder.

Change-Id: Ia72b935575ed8b7c635e8f8edeea835754b2d49f

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-07-06 13:08:20.000000000', 'message': 'Expose over-quota exceptions via native API.

Fixes bug LP 1021373.

Previously an over-quota condition would be exposed via the EC2 API,
but hidden in the corresponding call via the native API (in the sense
of the exception detail being replaced with a generic 500 Server Error
response).

We now report any NovaException declared to be safe. In this patch,
the set of safe exception types includes any subclass of QuotaError,
but in subsequent patches the net should be widened to include
exceptions that do not expose senstive information.

Change-Id: I3cc36337c7e67cf487ca49de646c437c217ae538

commit_message:
Expose over-quota exceptions via native API.

Fixes bug LP 1021373.

Previously an over-quota condition would be exposed via the EC2 API,
but hidden in the corresponding call via the native API (in the sense
of the exception detail being replaced with a generic 500 Server Error
response).

We now report any NovaException declared to be safe. In this patch,
the set of safe exception types includes any subclass of QuotaError,
but in subsequent patches the net should be widened to include
exceptions that do not expose senstive information.

Change-Id: I3cc36337c7e67cf487ca49de646c437c217ae538

commit_message:
heat : update config files with new rpc backend

heat-engine.conf, heat-api.conf, heat-metadata.conf
should have:
rpc_backend=heat.openstack.common.rpc.impl_qpid
to work with the reworked rpc code.

Change-Id: I2e5b136240db2fe8f6dfad27da7e31b2a5053a1c
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix requirements recursion.

Can't actually depend on setuptools-git in setup_requires while we're
processing dependency links in the same package. That's ok - we can manage
that by hand for this one.

Change-Id: I751d04102b9c110c0c7f86d3e0a1d7789274b9da

This change set adds the newly written OCF resource agent to Keystone
in order to make it possible to run Keystone as a resource managed by
the Pacemaker cluster manager. Further details about this agent (and
the ones for Glance, too) can be found in this extensive blog post I
wrote when initially putting them up for testing:

http://www.hastexo.com/blogs/martin/2012/04/03/bringing-high-availability-openstack-keystone-and-glance

Change-Id: Id4d792c2a6bcb9bdcb93e9fa88c9b32114e61f81
'}]
commit_message:
Add an OCF resource agent to Keystone.

Implements blueprint ocf-support.

This change set adds the newly written OCF resource agent to Keystone
in order to make it possible to run Keystone as a resource managed by
the Pacemaker cluster manager. Further details about this agent (and
the ones for Glance, too) can be found in this extensive blog post I
wrote when initially putting them up for testing:

http://www.hastexo.com/blogs/martin/2012/04/03/bringing-high-availability-openstack-keystone-and-glance

Change-Id: Id4d792c2a6bcb9bdcb93e9fa88c9b32114e61f81

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-07-16 16:08:49.000000000', 'message': 'Prevent client from overriding important headers.

The glance client offered the opportunity to override
important headers via the features parameter during image
creation or update.

Created a blacklist of unsupported features like:
content-length
content-type
x-image-meta-size

These headers should not be overriden by the client.

Fixes LP Bug #1023892

Change-Id: I14aac59e00a2672fd98f6dab221096ab5de86855
'}]
commit_message:
Prevent client from overriding important headers.

The glance client offered the opportunity to override
important headers via the features parameter during image
creation or update.

Created a blacklist of unsupported features like:
content-length
content-type
x-image-meta-size

These headers should not be overriden by the client.

Fixes LP Bug #1023892

Change-Id: I14aac59e00a2672fd98f6dab221096ab5de86855

[{'created': '2012-07-17 14:43:59.000000000', 'message': 'Use global cfg.CONF instead of config classes

Importing rpc.common requires the use of the global cfg.CONF.
In fact, most of common requires the use of this global.  This
patch removes all the object specific access to config options
and directly accesses the global in prep for rpc openstack-common
import.

Change-Id: I5989a436964c199df0dc38dbb191dc3d867e5ce7
Signed-off-by: Steven Dake <sdake@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Use global cfg.CONF instead of config classes

Importing rpc.common requires the use of the global cfg.CONF.
In fact, most of common requires the use of this global.  This
patch removes all the object specific access to config options
and directly accesses the global in prep for rpc openstack-common
import.

Change-Id: I5989a436964c199df0dc38dbb191dc3d867e5ce7
Signed-off-by: Steven Dake <sdake@redhat.com>

commit_message:
cfg: allow empty config values

Fixes bug #1025522

Commit 83044a7 caused this to stop working in Quantum:

  api_extensions_path =

and could only be worked around with:

  api_extensions_path = ""

Change-Id: I8c1a57225a2c135e6baf567b8e71d61e974da4e2

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-07-17 09:37:11.000000000', 'message': 'Add an OCF resource agent to Keystone.

Implements blueprint ocf-support.

This change set adds the newly written OCF resource agent to Keystone
in order to make it possible to run Keystone as a resource managed by
the Pacemaker cluster manager. Further details about this agent (and
the ones for Glance, too) can be found in this extensive blog post I
wrote when initially putting them up for testing:

http://www.hastexo.com/blogs/martin/2012/04/03/bringing-high-availability-openstack-keystone-and-glance

Change-Id: I523ce1f724d3a4331cc2b67f6148e589c7c94209
'}]
commit_message:
Add an OCF resource agent to Keystone.

Implements blueprint ocf-support.

This change set adds the newly written OCF resource agent to Keystone
in order to make it possible to run Keystone as a resource managed by
the Pacemaker cluster manager. Further details about this agent (and
the ones for Glance, too) can be found in this extensive blog post I
wrote when initially putting them up for testing:

http://www.hastexo.com/blogs/martin/2012/04/03/bringing-high-availability-openstack-keystone-and-glance

Change-Id: I523ce1f724d3a4331cc2b67f6148e589c7c94209

commit_message:
connection_type => compute_driver

Convert examples that use connection_type to compute_driver with
appropriate driver strings. There probably needs to be slightly more
explanation of the change. Also, there are additional tables that
are not modified by this patch, as I was unclear if they were
autogenerated or not.

Patchset does an include for updates
to the hypervisor config table and common config table
with the new compute_driver settings.

Change-Id: I5cdfb1a59c9029760de4796127bfbe16f4306d4c

don't work out of the box on the saio. Fixes bug #1024561

messages:

'}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2012-07-09 17:08:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(3 inline comments)

minor nit on using openstack common timeutils instead of built-ins. Question about the change in function on the fake memcache for testing"}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-07-09 17:17:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-07-09 17:19:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (3 inline comments)

Joe: Addressed the comments in Patch 2.'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-07-09 17:25:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I've discovered that the problem I was seeing with memcache returning keys that should be expired is likely due to a timezone issue.  Setting token expiry to 20m and then checking if keystone would ever report a token as expired discovered that expiry occured after 5 hours 20m, consistent with a -5h UTC offset - EST.  I'm betting that memcache is configured to use the system timezone, and if that timezone is not utc, the skew will result in tokens not expiring as expected.

-1 to ensure that this change does not get accidentally approved.  It is up to the core reviewers as to whether this patch is still wanted.  It will prevent the server's configured timezone from affecting token expiry, but maybe documentation could cover that instead."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-07-09 17:44:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build successful

commit_message:
Fix token expiry in memcache token backend

 * Added explicit check for expiry on token retrieval
 * Removed expiry check in fake MemcacheClient used for testing,
   since this behaviour doesn't seem to be present in
   python-memcached.
 * Addresses bug 1022614

Change-Id: Ia3c3f4976abda8795807ca6b11dcbbca7d690866

commit_message:
Check for an valid zone before creating a volume.

In order to create a volume, one must specifiy
a zone to be created. If an invalid zone is specified
then the volume should not be created.

Check the zone to see if it exists before creating it,
display a message about zone not existing if it doesnt.

This fixes LP: #1016111

Change-Id: I3e2565360afdfc0c5e9326e1af9a6b39c6a69df3
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Don't switch to list_notifier unless necessary.

Some notification tests depend on a different, single notifier being
used. So, don't switch to the list notifier just because we loaded
this class; only switch if an actual plugin needs it.

Also: improved the test that makes sure all this notifier-switching
doesn't break the notifier that was present in the first place.

Change-Id: I170477bccb3ad9505fe6dbfbc214f77c09f6862f

commit_message:
Get rid of eval() in authentication code

This was not secure. Pass the auth data in JSON format rather than as a
serialised Python object.

Fixes #124

Change-Id: I8e1e9aef790b0af026da2a2d6194da19345be8b0
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

Devstack support for Quantum DHCP

Fixes bug 1019462.

A new screen q-dhcp is created for the agent output.

ERROR: could not install deps [-r/home/jenkins/workspace/gate-nova-python27/tools/pip-requires, -r/home/jenkins/workspace/gate-nova-python27/tools/test-requires]'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2012-06-27 17:59:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Possibly a bad quote, this one is better:

git fetch https://review.openstack.org/p/openstack/nova refs/changes/29/8329/8
error: RPC failed; result=22, HTTP code = 503
fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly

and

timed out downloading from pypi'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-06-27 19:58:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-06-27 20:03:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

As per https://lists.launchpad.net/openstack/msg13742.html it would be nice to see the id to uuid change split out from this patch set."}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2012-06-27 21:04:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(4 inline comments)

looks good overall, minor nits inline."}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2012-06-27 21:48:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: (5 inline comments)

I agree with being better about splitting out the change, but I was taking the approach I was told to use last month: work in a feature branch, stabilize the code, then squash in a single change and submit back to trunk. Its going to be quite painful to pull out the uuid move (it got added as part of the merge with the rpc api changes, although I know I could do it in too steps, but it would mean me adding new API calls using _id rather than uuid, which I assumed would be rejected).

What do you think is the best approach?'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-06-27 21:54:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

You can first convert existing functionality to uuid, and then add your live migration patch dependent on the first patch set.


Also I see you added some tests to libvirt but the docs commit msg only talks about xenapi code.'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2012-06-28 17:50:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Hi, there is no new libvirt code, it is just code that had to be refactored to allow the Xen code to be added.

Not had any time on the keyboard today, but hopefully I will get chance tomorrow.

I will abandon this change, and re-write it in the separate stages.

However, I was previously told to do this in a branch so I don't submit "half-baked" features into trunk. I assume that has now been decided against?'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2012-06-28 17:52:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Abandoned

As previous comment, moving to reimplement/re-submit as separate changes.'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-06-28 17:53:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

John,  we still do not want half-baked  features in trunk.  But if the patch is actually to features (uuid change, and xen live migration) then it should be split up.'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2012-06-28 17:59:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

OK, sure, I get you. Just I would ordinary would commit smaller units than that to help document the changes in the git history.

One last question. Shoudl I do the libvirt refactor as a separate change. The issue is that the refactor looks pointless without the xenapi additions.'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-06-28 18:02:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

John, I am fine with leaving the libvirt changes in here,  as long as there is a brief comment in the commitlog'}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2012-06-28 18:12:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

FWIW, it's technically not necessary to abandon this change to split it up.

When you do update it in the future, can you use the proposed format for commit messages? It would be nice to get a one line summary as the first line."}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2012-06-30 18:02:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Restored

Bringing back, as the re-write was not quite so bad as I first thought.'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2012-06-30 18:02:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2012-06-30 18:06:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Work In Progress

This still needs some more tidying, but getting closer.
Not had anything more than unit tests so far.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-06-30 18:15:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Works for me

John, this looks awesome. I like the cleanup in the virt/scheduler code for live migration. It might be easier to review if it were split into two patches. One for the refactoring of the existing code, and a dependent patch to add the xen version and tests.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-07-06 01:33:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

Looking over the refactor code there is one thing i dislike marked inline. Thoughts about how we could fix it?"}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2012-07-06 09:20:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: (2 inline comments)

I have suggested a resolution in line. Basically add capability calls between driver and manager. It is messy though, anyone got a neater idea?

I can split this into two if needed, once the above is resolved, it was decided against in the previous round of reviews, from which I split out a the uuid change. However the split for XenServer, I think, is simply to move those XenAPI files into another change set, so not a big deal either way for me.'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2012-07-09 14:27:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2012-07-09 14:28:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Work In Progress

First attempt at splitting out XenAPI changes from the re factoring.

I will now look at another refactoring to remove the rpc calls from the driver code.'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2012-07-09 16:27:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

I have documented my ideas for the refactoring here:
http://wiki.openstack.org/XenServer/LiveMigration#Live_Migration_RPC_Calls

Basically splitting check_can_live_migrate into two calls: check_can_live_migrate_destination and check_can_live_migrate_source with a dictionary passed between to two to allow for comparisons (for example, with CPU, and shared file check).'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-07-09 17:23:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

john: sounds reasonable. And these calls will be done in the manager layer and delegated to the driver on the remote end so we can stop making calls from the driver layer?'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2012-07-09 18:08:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13:

vish: yep, my plan is to delegate all of the call for check_can_live_migrate_source to the driver, the compute manger for check_can_live_migrate_destination (called by the scheduler) will first run the driver call, then pass it's return value (a dictionary) to the check_can_live_migrate_source call.

Things like the shared file check can write the file on destination, then pass the filename to the source, which can then check the file exists, then return to the destination where the file can be deleted. CPU check can work by collecting the values and passing them to the other host in a very similar way.

Hopefully that makes sense."}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2012-07-09 18:10:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

This might help make sense of the previous comment:
https://github.com/citrix-openstack/nova/commit/6b9d3b938731a5f7cffd3e62a44a676eac57a58b'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-07-10 01:35:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13:

great, can't wait to see it."}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2012-07-10 17:40:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2012-07-10 17:41:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Work In Progress

'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-07-12 18:32:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 19: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(3 inline comments)

a little extra code left inline. Otherwise looks good. I really appreciate the tests.

I'm mildly concerned about the changes to the rpcapi. Since we haven't been versioned prior and this is relatively edge case for messages, it might be ok to just make the small modifications as you did without backwards compatibility but I'd like russel to take a look at it to see if he can see a way to version it up instead."}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-07-12 19:33:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 19: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(4 inline comments)

My reivew is only based around the rpc changes and related versioning issues.  These changes certainly break backwards compatibility of the rpc API.  I left some notes where versions need to be bumped.

As for how to make it backwards compatibility, would something like this work?

1) Add back all of the functions that were removed in compute/manager.py, but make them no-ops.  It would be nice to be able to use one of these as the hook for doing the new checks, but none of these methods have enough info in the parameters.

2) Do checking as to whether live migration can work in live_migration() in compute/manager.py.  I'm not sure if this is possible.  It would require being able to know that the checks were not done previously by the scheduler.  It would also push the live migration failure to be later in the process, and we'd have to verify that the failure is graceful."}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2012-07-13 08:58:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 19: (4 inline comments)

Good point. For some reason I had it stuck in my head we were leaving final Folsom as V1, but I understand what why this would be a bit stupid.

I will take a look at backwards compatibility. I don't want to clutter the code too much with lots of glue to fix this backwards compatibility. I guess it is more important to ensure obvious failures when running miss-matched versions, and ensure predictable behaviour? I will see what I can do to keep things working with minimal code changes."}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2012-07-13 10:08:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 20.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-07-13 10:25:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 20: Doesn't seem to work

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/3712/testReport : SUCCESS
"}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2012-07-13 11:15:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 21.'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2012-07-13 11:25:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21:

So I have gone for breaking backwards compatibility, but ensuring things are correctly versioned.

I will see if there is something lightweight to make things more backwards compatible, but most options seem to add a lot of code bloat.

It think this means:
- If you upgrade the scheduler, it means you can't do live migration until you updated the two compute node doing migration.
- If you don't upgrade the scheduler, you can only do upgrades between old compute nodes, it will fail on newer nodes.

At least live migration is a specific action that fails, not just "keep the cloud" running while you do the upgrade failure. Of course this assumes they are first upgrading nova, then upgrading hypervisors (i.e. they don't need to do live-migration half way through the upgrade).

Ideas?'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-07-13 11:37:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21: Works for me

This refactoring of the libvirt live migration code is
required to enable live migration in the xenapi driver.

This changes ensure that checks that driver specific checks
are only performed when that driver is enabled.

The complication is that some of these checks require
information to be passed between the source and destination
hosts. For example, when comparing CPU flags.

Change-Id: I7389f0b7f03313d7f04b907f481787dadf0716fd

commit_message:
Refactoring required for blueprint xenapi-live-migration

This refactoring of the libvirt live migration code is
required to enable live migration in the xenapi driver.

This change ensures libvirt specific checks are performed
only when the libvirt driver is enabled.

The complication is that some of these checks require
information to be passed between the source and destination
hosts. For example, when comparing CPU flags.

Change-Id: I7389f0b7f03313d7f04b907f481787dadf0716fd

'}, {'account_id': 4460, 'date': '2012-07-09 06:22:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Thanks for doing this, I think this improves well the fix in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/9429/

Just curious: any reason you're using the HTTP status code to find the webob exception, instead of directly referencing the webob exception from NovaException subclasses? Both way work fine, but the latter would avoid the need for a dictionary in FaultWrapper."}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-07-09 07:37:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@Vincent

I wanted to avoid a very direct coupling between the nova.exception and corresponding webob.exc exception type, also some nova.exception types already carried a code attribute to capture the appropriate status code.

So on the principle of least change (as this fix is proposed to stable/essex also), it seemed the most minimal approach was to just continue pattern of adding the status code to the nova.exception representation (as opposed to a direct reference to the webob.exc type).

Cheers,
Eoghan'}, {'account_id': 4460, 'date': '2012-07-09 08:02:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Return 413 status on over-quota in the native API.

Related to LP 1021373.

Previously we returned a generic 500 Server Error on an over-quota
conditions, whereas this is arguably more appropriately reported
as a 413 status.

Change-Id: I5c1cdc9db54804c512d60e4179c1faa13516d6f9

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-integration-tests-devstack-vm/5945/consoleFull : FAILURE
"}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2012-06-23 15:40:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(14 inline comments)

"}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-06-25 17:54:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

There is one use case I am trying to account for:

A xenapi user wants to use multiple aggregates for smart scheduling decisions, but they need to also tie an aggregate to a resource pool to enable things like live migration.  I can see two options for achieving this:

a) have a separate call for creating/modifying aggregates and adding the aggregate to a hypervisor pool.  Only the hypervisor pool call needs to be passed all the way down to the compute host where it can be validated using the current code (this is what I was suggesting earlier)

b) pick some special metadata for pool support. For example, decide that the key value "hypervisor_pool" = "pool_name" means that the hypervisor should add the aggregate to the specified pool. The hypervisor could be notified of all aggregate changes, but only do the pool based logic if the metadata is set.

In either case the extra status data could be moved into metadata instead of having its own field in the DB, but this could also be done in a subsequent patch. I don't want to pick an implementation that breaks xen hypervisor pools or that disallows hypervisor pools combined with aggregates for scheduling.'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-06-25 22:18:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: (9 inline comments)

Armando: I will move nova/compute/aggregate_state.py to nova/virt/xenapi/pool_state.py

Vishy,  Armando,

First of all thank you both for your patience while we find a solution that satisfies all parties.


I prefer option b since it doesn't require changing the API.  I will add the logic to look for the metadata "hypervisor_pool = pool_name."

Before I can continue I have a few questions:

Q:  Where should the pool based logic live? In the XenAPI namespace?  As it is I currently move the operational_state to metadata.

Q: How deal with setting aggregate state upon creation?  Should I do something if the hypervisor_pool flag exists for the aggregate?'}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2012-06-27 20:41:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

I'd favor option b too. Also, I would agree that dropping the state column is something that could be dealt with at a later stage, but I am not sure what we'd gain by doing so.

As for Joe's questions:

Q: Where should the pool based logic live? In the XenAPI namespace? As it is I currently move the operational_state to metadata.

The logic that was once in the manager/api should probably live in the virt namespace as it is 100% hypervisor-agnostic.

Q: How deal with setting aggregate state upon creation? Should I do something if the hypervisor_pool flag exists for the aggregate?

I think that makes sense."}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-06-28 00:40:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-06-28 00:45:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Inline 'done' comments.

* pool based logic is currently in XenAPI namespace.  Going forward I would be happy to see this be moved into the virt namespace.  But hoping to leave that out of scope of this patch.

* In the current version, the the hypervisor_pool metadata must be set manually."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-06-28 00:55:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Doesn't seem to work

Many thanks,
Armando"}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2012-07-05 10:30:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: (3 inline comments)

I feel this is good enough to merge, awesome work!

I had a little idea to help simplify the code if you the _is_hv_pool check into the compute manager, but feel free to ignore that comment. It's maybe where I would put the other pool state management code too, but that can be for another day also.

Armando is correctly worried about the admin accidentally putting one machine into the two hypervisor pools. I would raise a bug for that and deal with it a bit later on. In most cases the request will be rejected by XenAPI, its only when you have a host in one pool aggregate by its-self, and then add it into another pool aggregate, strange things might happen."}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-07-10 00:35:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

I will file a bug in launchpad about "the admin accidentally putting one machine into the two hypervisor pools" once this patch is merged.  


Armando, Do John's comments address your concerns?'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-07-10 06:05:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(3 inline comments)

Minor nits inline.... but I think there's at least some missing indenting that should be fixed before this goes in.

I also would like to avoid adding more DB updates in the virt drivers if possible.  The metadata_get()s seem like they could be done in compute/manager.py and passed down.. and if there's any updates to make.. seems like they could be returned.  That eliminates some work for other drivers.  At some point we'll want code that runs on hosts to not have access (at least write access) to the DB.  But, this is fine as-is.  Just something to think about."}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-07-10 21:42:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: (3 inline comments)

commit_message:
General-host-aggregates part 1.

Partially implements blueprint general-host-aggregates: Xen decoupling

* keep rpcapi to compute-controller for Hypervisor-Pools
  *  Add compute_rpcapi.add_aggregate_host to libvirt
* Remove aggregate states
* Remove One aggregate per host restriction
* Keep Xen support for both hypervisor pools and aggregates

Change-Id: I6ac0f8b6fc31dff589363331e99e0755301f2172

commit_message:
Remove VDI chain limit for migrations.

The strategy for removing the limit is to refactor migration so that
they work nearly identically to snapshots, meaning sequence-numbered
VHDs are rsynced over into a staging-area and then imported into the SR
using the `import_vhds` function.

Change-Id: Ibf5c82c52ae7d505ea9e54d64fcc8b8fdce4d05d

[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-07-12 14:52:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build successful

'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-07-12 22:42:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I want to make sure this is a valid use case before we accept this patch. Glance's job  has historically been to associate some metadata with a blob of data. Now this patch is making the first requirement optional, right? What would happen if I wanted to 'download' this image? Is it even considered an 'image' anymore?"}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-07-13 09:48:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-07-13 09:50:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@bcwaldon

The intended use-case is implementing the EC2 CreateImage API for nova booted-from-volume instances.

The idea of the placeholder image is described in this mail:

  https://lists.launchpad.net/openstack/msg13639.html

In this case, the "image" is more of a collection of properties that reference image data held elsewhere (i.e. the kernel/ramdisk IDs, and particularly the snapshot ID that's used to create a volume containing the root device data).

So its not so much that there's no image data, more than the image data is referenced via indirection.

The result is that a nova server can be booted entirely from the image properties, without providing this information via some ancillary route (e.g. the nova boot --block_device_mapping option).

Good point about attempts to download the image data, we should handle this gracefully. I've added to the latest patch set to return empty data if the size is zero.

Cheers,
Eoghan'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-07-13 10:04:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build successful

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-glance-merge/1310/consoleFull : SUCCESS

'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-07-13 14:34:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Interesting use case. Kind of like a "meta image" of sorts.

Seems reasonable.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-07-13 15:34:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Any way we can add a unit test for this as well, Eoghan? Overall, I'm fine with the change to the status transition for this use case... just would like to see a unit test for it in addition to the functional one.

Thanks!

-jay"}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-07-14 11:27:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-07-14 11:28:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Unit test added as requested.

Cheers,
Eoghan'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-07-14 11:43:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

Also, Eoghan, would you mind adding a note to the docs/source/statuses.rst document that notes this edge case? I think it's an important thing to note in the docs.

Best,

commit_message:
Support zero-size image creation via the v1 API

Addresses LP 1025353 for the v1 API.

Transition image status to active immediately on creation
(as opposed to leaving it queued forever) if the size is set
to zero from the get-go.

The v2 implementation is left unchanged for now, as the image
status does not appear to ever transition from queued to active
in that case.

This change allows an image to be created that simply acts as
a properties bucket, but requires no image data. For example,
an image created from a booted-from-volume instance where only
the kernel, ramdisk ID, and block device mappings are required.

Change-Id: I61e96f3fe5f5245fec791170b4a8b4c72135c3de

commit_message:
devstack support for v2 nova/quantum integration

Adds support to use v1 or v2 quantum api via  NOVA_USE_QUANTUM_API

This fixes bug 1017760

Change-Id: Iaf77b830edc51fd4c820ddff9e1f482bc4c9904d

Adding granularity for quotas to list and update

added quotas:show and quotas:update to policy.json
defaulting quotas:update to an admin-api default

commit_message:
heat engine/API : Internal API rework

Refactor engine-api code so that AWS specific
details like key names are handled in the API
Fixes #172

Change-Id: I4c5b153557216c03e5a98193e54cf75e3c7b97dd
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

commit_message:
update list of files for git to ignore

These files are all created in the course of running
devstack and openstack but should not be tracked
as part of the devstack sources.

Change-Id: Ia3939c6e20f8d6fadaa18d2f3619361dc9375696
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

FAIL: testHead (test.functional.tests.TestFile)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/q/zaitcev/hail/swift-tip/test/functional/tests.py", line 1194, in testHead

AssertionError: 13 != 128

This may be my own local issue, but I cannot +1 unitl I know for sure.'}, {'account_id': 4405, 'date': '2012-06-18 00:25:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Pete Zaitcev, Did you try this patch with WebOb 1.2? not 1.2b3?'}, {'account_id': 4405, 'date': '2012-06-19 14:17:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-06-19 14:19:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Doesn't seem to work

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-swift-python27/191/ : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 4405, 'date': '2012-06-19 14:43:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

I tested new patch set with webob 1.0.8 and webob 1.2 and confirmed in SAIO environment.

With webob 1.1, functests failed, but it's not related the patch set.

Current master branch failed to pass functests with WebOb 1.1 as well. So, attached failed tests message might be another bug report.

======================================================================
FAIL: testHead (test.functional.tests.TestFile)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/simple/swift/test/functional/tests.py", line 1205, in testHead
    self.assertEquals(info['content_length'], self.env.file_size)
AssertionError: 13 != 128

======================================================================
FAIL: testHead (test.functional.tests.TestFileUTF8)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/simple/swift/test/functional/tests.py", line 1205, in testHead
    self.assertEquals(info['content_length'], self.env.file_size)
AssertionError: 13 != 128

----------------------------------------------------------------------'}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2012-06-19 22:17:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Indeed the content-length:13 was a failure on webob-1.1.1. When I run on webob-1.2 (final), I get a failure in byte ranges, because webob/byterange.py:_rx_range forgot to use re.I flag in re.compile().

Although the webob springs a bug after bug at us, I approve of this patch.

It is not complete, because it needs the fix for proxy_logging module, which I sent to Iryoung in e-mail, but what is there, works. I can file a separate review for that one.'}, {'account_id': 4405, 'date': '2012-06-20 03:35:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

I applied the patch by Pete Zaitcev in the patch set 5.

IMO, ProxyLoggingMiddleware.log_request() method is too big, so I extract the method and make them more common, and put it to common.utils and added some unittests.

So, please check the patch set 5 which could reflect your intention.'}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2012-06-27 23:40:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

I can't vouch for the other webob versions this supports, but it works with my webob 1.0.8. It seems curious to support 1.2 if we know it's broken, but I guess it doesn't affect what I'm up to, so I won't object. :)"}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2012-06-28 07:33:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

It seems that we still have a failure with test.unit.container.test_sync.TestContainerSync with webob 1.2 final (http://pastie.org/4164302) is it supposed to happen with this review? webob 1.0* works for me.'}, {'account_id': 4405, 'date': '2012-06-28 23:08:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

@gholt thanks for your review. Almost nobody care about this review for a long time, so I was wondering whether I did something wrong or not.

@Chmouel Boudjnah
I've tested against webob 1.0.8 & webob 1.2 with python 2.6.6 and python 2.7.3, and I couldn't see the failure about TestContainerSync.

So, could you please tell me more detailed test environment?"}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-07-13 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Abandoned

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-07-13 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2012-07-13 06:37:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Apologies to have not answered to you on this earlier, I didn't manage to reproduce the error and this should be good to go. Please feel free to recover and I'll Approve based on gholt previous +2."}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2012-07-13 14:59:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Iryong is the only one who can restore. However, if he doesn't do it, I'll incorporate his code into my patch and resubmit.

Note that dealing with WebOb is going to be an ongoing struggle, so expect more patches along these lines as distros roll out 1.2 and futher revisions.

WebOb just merged my fix for RANGE: BYTES= a day ago, BTW. It came from running ./.functests against a server on WebOb 1.2."}, {'account_id': 4405, 'date': '2012-07-14 15:28:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Restored

I thought, only negative commented reviews would abandoned after 2 weeks :(

Anyway, sorry for not asking any advice or pinging other people before abandoned.
(Actually, this is one of the reason I'd like to develop openstack as full-time developer. Recently I should've done some stuffs related my company requested to me which is related internal distributed file system.. which is somewhat boring than swift. :-(

After restore this change, I'll upload new patch set which is rebased on the latest master branch."}, {'account_id': 4405, 'date': '2012-07-14 15:28:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-07-14 15:31:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Works for me

Patch Set 6 is rebased on the latest master branch.
And I've tested it on both python 2.6 & 2.7 with webob 1.0.8 & 1.2.

@Pete yes, there're some issues with WebOb 1.2 which made me patch WebOb like this, too.

https://github.com/Pylons/webob/commit/1fb2fc7092b530763ddbcd3bb73b06e569bd1d49

But, until this kinds of new merges of WebOb released official version, I let unittests just skip affected tests.

BTW, after I saw +2 on this patch set, I thought it'll be approved, and I was busy with my company works, so I couldn't watch this often which is just my hobby projects..:( does anybody can introduce job position which offer full-time openstack development? please let me know by email.

Sorry for talking about my personal story here :)"}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2012-07-16 15:45:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

commit_message:
Adapt Swift for WebOb 1.2

Based on PatchSet 3 of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/7569/ , make them to pass all funcional tests with both webob 1.x and 1.2.

The additional following compatibility issues were addressed:
 - Until patch for range header issue is merged into official webob release, testRangedGetsWithLWSinHeader() should skip test against webob 1.2
(https://github.com/Pylons/webob/commit/49c175aec2b5c134511dfea6564bfb1d37ab23a9)

 - common.constraints.check_utf8() can accept both utf8 str and unicode.

 - To convert unicode to utf-8 str if necessary.

 - Making proxy_logging can handle invalid utf-8 str

bug 888371
bug 959881

blueprint webob-support

Change-Id: I00e5fd04cd1653259606a4ffdd4926db3c84c496

commit_message:
Consume version info from pkg_resources.

Documenation builds specify a version in doc/source/conf.py that is
used in appropriate places through out the documentation. Previously
this value had not been defined properly and documentation builds
failed. Retrieve the version info using pkg_resources and set it
properly.

Use openstack.common.version to consume the generated version information
for documentation. Additional, add a swiftclient.__version__ member which
will return the version of swiftclient being used.

Change-Id: I14f3abdf00da3f9ea7d0651efe76b08f69ddabae

[{'created': '2012-07-09 01:04:52.000000000', 'message': 'Adds new parameter interpolations for tempest config

Tempest recently added a number of new config variables
and this patch merely adds those variables to the
template replacement process in tools/configure_tempest.sh

This needs to go in before this:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/8738/2

Additionally, this patch sets the build_interval to 3
and the build_timeout to 400. This faster status check
interval should allow Tempest to run a bit quicker in the
Jenkins gate job.

Change-Id: I8835ccdee6af58da66c6327ddae8a05b6789d454
'}]
commit_message:
Adds new parameter interpolations for tempest config

Tempest recently added a number of new config variables
and this patch merely adds those variables to the
template replacement process in tools/configure_tempest.sh

This needs to go in before this:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/8738/2

Additionally, this patch sets the build_interval to 3
and the build_timeout to 400. This faster status check
interval should allow Tempest to run a bit quicker in the
Jenkins gate job.

Change-Id: I8835ccdee6af58da66c6327ddae8a05b6789d454

commit_message:
Add tar to list of packages to install

It turns out a minimal Fedora installation doesn't have tar by default.
Since we use tar when uploading the default image to glance, we need to
make sure it's installed. And since it might be useful for other very
generic tasks DevStack might do, just always install it (by putting it
in the general list of packages).

Change-Id: I4dae3b43a700d80b8752a5b846a6ce302fadb751

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-07-13 15:14:11.000000000', 'message': 'Allow user to override pip cache location

Building a VM containing devstack is faster if you can save
the cache files for pip in a location that is not deleted
when the VM is rebuilt. This change allows the user to
set the PIP_DOWNLOAD_CACHE in their localrc file to point
to any directory writable by root, including a directory
mounted from the host containing the VM.

Change-Id: I27179c1c212140d6734f6725f498be52fd18e9ed
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Allow user to override pip cache location

Building a VM containing devstack is faster if you can save
the cache files for pip in a location that is not deleted
when the VM is rebuilt. This change allows the user to
set the PIP_DOWNLOAD_CACHE in their localrc file to point
to any directory writable by root, including a directory
mounted from the host containing the VM.

Change-Id: I27179c1c212140d6734f6725f498be52fd18e9ed
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

[{'created': '2012-07-16 15:36:20.000000000', 'message': 'Use strtime() in to_primitive() for datetime objs.

This patch updates jsonutils.to_primitive() to use timeutils.strtime()
to convert a datimetime object to a string instead of just using str().
This ensures that we can easily convert the string back to a datetime
using timeutils.parse_strtime().

Required for the nova blueprint no-db-messaging.

Change-Id: I725b333695930e12e2832378102514326fec639c
'}]
commit_message:
Use strtime() in to_primitive() for datetime objs.

This patch updates jsonutils.to_primitive() to use timeutils.strtime()
to convert a datimetime object to a string instead of just using str().
This ensures that we can easily convert the string back to a datetime
using timeutils.parse_strtime().

Required for the nova blueprint no-db-messaging.

Change-Id: I725b333695930e12e2832378102514326fec639c

commit_message:
Catch rpc up to the common state-of-the-art.

This propagates the following patch from common into nova:

  Author: Jason Kölker <jason@koelker.net>
  Date:   Tue Jul 10 11:12:50 2012 -0500

      Fix Zmq so it doesn't rely on nova flags

      * Embeded newlines in logging makes me cry
      * String formatting uses parens not curly braces
      * Fix LP1023039
      * Hard skip Zmq tests so jenkins passes. Someone will have to fix.

Change-Id: I651aa10861cb26808fa46e74a7db545fb2fd23b8

commit_message:
Establish the supported importable interface

* Consumers of this client should not depend on being able to import
  any module other than glanceclient and glanceclient
* The only attributs of the glanceclient module are Client
  and __version__
* The attributes of the glanceclient.exc modules have yet to be
  locked down
* glanceclient.common.exceptions was replaced with a placeholder
  module until consumers of it are updated

Change-Id: Iea9648cd06906d65764987c1f2ee5a88ebeee748

commit_message:
Import openstack.common.log and use inside heat infrastructure

Allows heat to match openstack-common log calling conventions such
as using a context object or instance UUID for better traceability.

Change-Id: Idaa6c04270d9d7143c85988d685c0f9e241b635b
Signed-off-by: Steven Dake <sdake@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2012-07-15 22:38:21.000000000', 'message': 'Allow non-interactive installation of OpenStack

Pass the arguments to the tools/openstack script through to openstack-db so
that scripts can use e.g. --yes and --rootpw.

Also use openstack-db --drop rather than heat-db-drop to drop the databases
for OpenStack services.

Change-Id: I87811ee02d3bfd7cc2dca8b9ab20ea3cfc220e3e
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Allow non-interactive installation of OpenStack

Pass the arguments to the tools/openstack script through to openstack-db so
that scripts can use e.g. --yes and --rootpw.

Also use openstack-db --drop rather than heat-db-drop to drop the databases
for OpenStack services.

Change-Id: I87811ee02d3bfd7cc2dca8b9ab20ea3cfc220e3e
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
pep8 cleanup

This file contains a line which is less than 80 chars,
but when imported into a project (e.g. nova) winds up
being longer than 80 chars.  This patch removes
a bit of leading whitespace to mitigate that problem.

Change-Id: I8840d170a6103f90a2f7cfd3cd69475ad8da9a24

[{'created': '2012-07-15 19:06:13.000000000', 'message': 'pep8 cleanup in the plugin code

The nova hacking test turned up one alphabetization error
that I missed previously.  Also, our path-altering
process caused one line to exceed 80 characters
when copied into nova; that line is shorter now.

Change-Id: Ia3acfc25ecc5ba388526766dae3ed03792e906e3
'}]
commit_message:
pep8 cleanup in the plugin code

The nova hacking test turned up one alphabetization error
that I missed previously.  Also, our path-altering
process caused one line to exceed 80 characters
when copied into nova; that line is shorter now.

Change-Id: Ia3acfc25ecc5ba388526766dae3ed03792e906e3

makes a tarball. This type of pre-version tagging is fairly specific to

Change-Id: I612f3483aa4c3f169e219b6c82e7d7e634e0474a
"}, {'created': '2012-07-15 16:02:26.000000000', 'message': "Don't attempt to fetch meta refs locally.

commit_message:
Don't attempt to fetch meta refs locally.

There isn't really any need to do a remote fetch every time a local dev
makes a tarball. This type of pre-version tagging is fairly specific to
OpenStack, and as such shouldn't bother normal people running normally.

Change-Id: I612f3483aa4c3f169e219b6c82e7d7e634e0474a

Add README.rst to the list of valid READMEs.

This is in the lastest distribute already, but the earlier versions still
warn about README.rst, which is annoying.

Change-Id: I30688fd11bb6871b4b51ef6f0090c0418b8394d6

commit_message:
Ensures API v2 router does not load plugin twice

Fixes bug 1020024

The router will simply use the QuantumManager which stores the instance
of the plugin being used by the Quantum server. Changes to unit tests
are for ensuring plugin instances are recycled across tests.

Change-Id: I339a40ee6fef74d938245e9c50c7ed695d866e3b

(1 inline comment)

Gary,
I think this patch is in good shape.
I just would like to see an upper limit or timeout for avoiding infinite reconnect loops.

On DB configuration, I am not sure whether we want to move to a different approach such as sqlalchemy-migrate, especially if we plan to ditch API v1 support in this release. 

Then we'll have to worry about migrate support only for v2, which would be quite better IMHO."}, {'account_id': 490, 'date': '2012-07-15 16:08:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

A suggestion and a question -

Suggestion (and this is a nit) - one of the reviewers has mentioned that the commit message/header should be changed. Per the convention, a short description like - "Refactoring DB access, introducing DB reconnect timer" might be good.

Question - I tried to install using devstack stable/essex, and the Quantum branch set to this review. However, the quantum service is not able to start due to this error -

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/opt/stack/quantum/bin/quantum-server", line 22, in <module>
    from quantum.server import main as server
  File "/opt/stack/quantum/quantum/server/__init__.py", line 36, in <module>
    from quantum import service
  File "/opt/stack/quantum/quantum/service.py", line 19, in <module>
    from quantum.common import config
ImportError: No module named common

Seems like when I pull this review branch, there is some inconsistency in the code. Or maybe I am not doing something right?'}, {'account_id': 704, 'date': '2012-07-15 16:08:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-07-15 16:08:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (4 inline comments)

Hi,
I have addressed the comments. Please note that this is a cherry pick for stable essex and if I understand correctly we do not want to add any new functionality.
Thanks
Gary'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-07-15 16:08:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

The problematic code that you mentioned was from the Quantum client. Below are the files that are managed by the client.

Hi Maru,
At the moment the only issue that is open is limiting the amount of retries. If the reconnect interval is not defined in the configuration file then this is set as default. If possible I would like this to be approved and then we handle the limit or retries in the future. At least this will enable the code to try and reconnect if there is a database problem (say for example if the database is not run on the same host and there is a networking problem). If we do not add the code then the Quantum service will terminate.
Thanks
Gary'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-07-15 16:08:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
blueprint database-common

This fixes bug 995438. If there is an database failure, for example, the
mysql service is down, then the agent or the service will attempt to
reconnect to the database every 'reconnect_interval'.

Change-Id: Iaee24b08e07a4f4dde5e27f31d3a5f81f5101466

We're doing files from git, so in general there should be no need for a
MANIFEST.in file. If there isn't one, create a temporary one that has
AUTHORS, ChangeLog and project/versioninfo in it, as well as exclusions of
.gitignore and .gitreview.

Change-Id: I271c8c2379f12f7a3382bd66d1c54f4a15e96e9d
"}]
commit_message:
Remove need for boilerplate MANIFEST.in

We're doing files from git, so in general there should be no need for a
MANIFEST.in file. If there isn't one, create a temporary one that has
AUTHORS, ChangeLog and project/versioninfo in it, as well as exclusions of
.gitignore and .gitreview.

Change-Id: I271c8c2379f12f7a3382bd66d1c54f4a15e96e9d

commit_message:
Added section on metadata at account level

Patchset fixes some validation problems so this will build with:
mvn clean generate-sources

- Add para tags around two paragraphs
- Remove code tags around an entity that wasn't resolving correctly
- Add xml:id to the new section

Patchset adds a paragraph about alternative method for deleting
metadata headers.

Patchset 4 adds an example with the alternate headers.

Change-Id: Ib2fa4cc1f4595d139fb39b11afca20aefb0582b7

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-07-14 13:58:25.000000000', 'message': "Fixed logic for disabling form button

This logic should be applied *only* for btn-primary
submit buttons, and not for regular buttons, which are
all of the action button in tables. At the moment this
logic breaks the table row actions, as it sets
button.disabled=true, and the 'action' value of the button
is not submitted, hence no action is performed.

Change-Id: I8e9827975656c53c7f8baff6554de1103bf4a358
"}]
commit_message:
Fixed logic for disabling form button

This logic should be applied *only* for btn-primary
submit buttons, and not for regular buttons, which are
all of the action button in tables. At the moment this
logic breaks the table row actions, as it sets
button.disabled=true, and the 'action' value of the button
is not submitted, hence no action is performed.

Change-Id: I8e9827975656c53c7f8baff6554de1103bf4a358

 * Added a link to to EC2 docs on metadata service.

Patchset 2 fixes typos - metad and wtih plus fixes typo in README.rst.
Patchset 3 removes files I didn't mean to add, sitemap.xml and updates to .htaccess.
Patchset 4 really removes .htaccess. Really.

commit_message:
More on fetching data from metadata server for Fedora images.

 * Added links RPMs for Fedora port of cloud-init
 * Added links to Yahoo's Openstack-Condense (Condenser)
 * Added a link to to EC2 docs on metadata service.

Patchset 2 fixes typos - metad and wtih plus fixes typo in README.rst.
Patchset 3 removes files I didn't mean to add, sitemap.xml and updates to .htaccess.
Patchset 4 really removes .htaccess. Really.

Cherrypicked from https://review.openstack.org/9481

Change-Id: I5d1d33a2a63c2bfe93f82783f30879900498e4c0

commit_message:
Change CLI options to use dashes

Change documented options to use dashes instead of underscores
in option names.  Continue to support old underscore names for
backward compatibility for a release or two (TBD).

* adds shell arg tests

Blueprint: command-options

Change-Id: Ia643eadec470c9d0f5bcd3fbb5854e7011b73fc3

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 67, 'name': 'Vish Ishaya', 'email': 'vishvananda@gmail.com', 'username': 'vishvananda'}, {'_account_id': 159, 'name': 'Eric Windisch', 'email': 'ewindisch@docker.com', 'username': 'ewindisch'}, {'_account_id': 970, 'name': 'Dean Troyer', 'email': 'dtroyer@gmail.com', 'username': 'dtroyer'}, {'_account_id': 1801, 'name': 'Duncan McGreggor', 'email': 'duncan.mcgreggor@rackspace.com', 'username': 'oubiwann'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 2592, 'name': 'Mark McClain', 'email': 'mark@mcclain.xyz', 'username': 'markmcclain'}, {'_account_id': 4460, 'name': 'Vincent Untz', 'email': 'vuntz@opensuse.org', 'username': 'vuntz'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 159, 'date': '2012-07-05 21:26:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Doug: Mixing tabs and spaces. Can you cleanup?'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-07-05 21:35:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build successful

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-devstack-merge/593/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-integration-tests-devstack-vm/7341/consoleFull : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 4460, 'date': '2012-07-06 07:34:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (2 inline comments)

That looks like a good idea to me. I've added some comments about the formatting itself.

Two things:

 - we probably want to handle the case of "ENABLED_SERVICES+=,-swift" which was added recently (in c4cd4140). If someone does "ENABLED_SERVICES+=,-swift" and then "enable_service swift", I think this won't work as expected.

 - I'd love to be able to support enabling/disabling nova, glance, quantum, and other services that are using the n-* magic. Disabling is actually not too difficult, but enabling is another story... Does it make sense to support disabling without enabling?'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2012-07-06 13:53:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2012-07-06 13:54:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (2 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2012-07-06 13:57:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Vincent, I don't know what "ENABLED_SERVICES+=,-swift" does. Can you point me toward something more detailed to explain it?

As far as enabling/disabling the service bundles for nova, et al, Dean specifically asked that I not include that feature. One compromise would be to create enable_nova, enable_glance, etc. as separate functions. If that's acceptable, I would like to do it in another changeset.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-07-06 14:02:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build successful

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-devstack-merge/596/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-integration-tests-devstack-vm/7386/consoleFull : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 4460, 'date': '2012-07-06 14:05:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Re "ENABLED_SERVICES+=,-swift", see the following commit: https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/commit/c4cd4140d3bb64a02321918df2f0f9258c6c4148'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2012-07-06 14:54:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2012-07-06 14:55:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2012-07-06 14:56:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Patch 4 includes fixes for the negated services feature along with some new tests and cleans up the whitespace in functions.sh which wasn't cleaned up in the earlier patches."}, {'account_id': 1801, 'date': '2012-07-06 15:00:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

commit_message:
add functions to manipulate ENABLED_SERVICES

Editing ENABLED_SERVICES directly can get tricky when
the user wants to disable something. This patch includes
two new functions for adding or removing services
safely, and a third (for completeness) to clear the
settings entirely before adding a minimal set of
services.

It also moves the logic for dealing with "negated"
services into a function so it can be tested and
applied by the new functions for manipulating
ENABLED_SERVICES.

Change-Id: I88f205f3666b86e6f0b6a94e0ec32a26c4bc6873
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-07-11 18:06:43.000000000', 'message': 'Always attempt to delete entire floating IP range.

Fix bug 1021222.

This patch tweaks nova-manage to always attempt to delete all addresses
in the specified IP range, even if an error is encountered.  This is an
easy way to handle a case where a range was created, but then a subset
of that range was deleted.  Otherwise, deleting the rest of the range is
a pain.

An example of this would be:

  # nova-manage floating create --ip_range=1.1.1.0/24
  # nova-manage floating delete 1.1.1.1
  # nova-manage floating delete 1.1.1.0/24

Previously this would fail.  Now it works.

Change-Id: Ia01c04dee5383f597976c6a79d9a0d9e19985898
'}]
commit_message:
Always attempt to delete entire floating IP range.

Fix bug 1021222.

This patch tweaks nova-manage to always attempt to delete all addresses
in the specified IP range, even if an error is encountered.  This is an
easy way to handle a case where a range was created, but then a subset
of that range was deleted.  Otherwise, deleting the rest of the range is
a pain.

An example of this would be:

  # nova-manage floating create --ip_range=1.1.1.0/24
  # nova-manage floating delete 1.1.1.1
  # nova-manage floating delete 1.1.1.0/24

Previously this would fail.  Now it works.

Change-Id: Ia01c04dee5383f597976c6a79d9a0d9e19985898

subject: Raise HTTP 500 if service catalog is not json.
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-07-11 19:17:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build successful

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-merge/4449/consoleFull : SUCCESS

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-python27/1899/testReport : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/3310/testReport : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-07-11 19:33:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-07-11 20:08:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm not sure 400 is appropriate, that would imply this is an error due to something the user did. This is more likely to happen due to a bad deployment, which would imply a 500, right?"}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-07-11 20:08:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

"}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-07-11 20:38:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I thought about using a 500 exception for this... 400 seemed more appropriate to me since it is actually a request. I'm Okay with either if people have a strong preference either way."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-07-11 20:57:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

400 vs 500 is all about assigning blame. 500 makes much more sense'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-07-11 20:57:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

and I don't understand your comment about this being 'a request', when is an HTTP request not 'a request'?"}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-07-12 18:11:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Brian:

By request I simply meant "user facing request". As in a user could send in their own 'X-Service-Catalog' header under some circumstances and cause this to happen.

This might happen for instance if a deployment used an implementation of Keystone (or other API service) that didn't return serviceCatalog in all of its responses. The field is 'optional'... If that happens then a user could inject their own service catalog into the request which could be invalid JSON thus causing this exception (and deserving of an invalid 400 response).

I would agree with you that this is somewhat of a contrived case. But it is certainly possible, user facing, and deserving of a 400 error. In general the intended path here is meant to be that a server generated request sets X-Service-Catalog via the auth token middleware... meaning we could interpret it as a server side error (aka 500).

Just wanted to let you in on why I chose 400 to begin with. It certainly seemed reasonable. Since you seem to really prefer the 500 I'll go ahead and change it.'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-07-12 18:21:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-07-12 18:22:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-07-12 18:23:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I was working off the assumption that a service catalog could not be passed in by a user. Looking at the auth token middleware, it does seem possible, but I would question that ability. We remove all the other auth-related headers, so why allow service catalog?'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-07-12 18:26:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Brian:

FYI. If you are interested in the auth_token side of things see this ticket:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/keystone/+bug/1023998'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-07-12 18:44:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-07-12 18:58:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Ok, we're on the same page now. Thanks, Dan!"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-07-12 20:19:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Doesn't seem to work

commit_message:
Raise HTTP 500 if service catalog is not json.

Updates the Nova API auth middleware so that it returns a HTTP
500 error if invalid JSON is found.

Adds a unit test.

Change-Id: I236ced13bac2164e103060e78845a410ceb6cdd4

One thing I'm worried here is that we're returning a 500 status code while over-quota exceptions are not failing because of the server, but because of the client. So it should be a 4xx error, imho (413 would work for most quotas).

We can add more attributes to the NovaException (like safe) to link to an appropriate webob exception, for instance."}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-07-06 14:29:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thanks for feedback, Vincent.

I had explained my reasoning on the linked bug as to why I preserved the 500 status code:

  https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1021373/comments/5

However, having read your comment above I'm veering towards agreeing that it would be useful to allow non-500 statuses (and headers) to be associated with a NovaException.

I'll propose a separate dependent patch to address that.

Cheers,
Eoghan"}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-07-06 16:18:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@Vincent

See this dependent patch for the status code related change discussed above:

[{'created': '2012-07-06 12:41:25.000000000', 'message': 'Expose over-quota exceptions via native API.

Fixes bug LP 1021373.

Previously an over-quota condition would be exposed via the EC2 API,
but hidden in the corresponding call via the native API (in the sense
of the exception detail being replaced with a generic 500 Server Error
response).

We now report any NovaException declared to be safe. In this patch,
the set of safe exception types includes any subclass of QuotaError,
but in subsequent patches the net should be widened to include
exceptions that do not expose senstive information.

Change-Id: I3cc36337c7e67cf487ca49de646c437c217ae538
'}, {'created': '2012-07-10 07:33:26.000000000', 'message': 'Expose over-quota exceptions via native API.

Previously an over-quota condition would be exposed via the EC2 API,
but hidden in the corresponding call via the native API (in the sense
of the exception detail being replaced with a generic 500 Server Error
response).

We now report any NovaException declared to be safe. In this patch,
the set of safe exception types includes any subclass of QuotaError,
but in subsequent patches the net should be widened to include
exceptions that do not expose senstive information.

Change-Id: I3cc36337c7e67cf487ca49de646c437c217ae538
'}]
commit_message:
Expose over-quota exceptions via native API.

Fixes bug LP 1021373.

Previously an over-quota condition would be exposed via the EC2 API,
but hidden in the corresponding call via the native API (in the sense
of the exception detail being replaced with a generic 500 Server Error
response).

We now report any NovaException declared to be safe. In this patch,
the set of safe exception types includes any subclass of QuotaError,
but in subsequent patches the net should be widened to include
exceptions that do not expose senstive information.

Change-Id: I3cc36337c7e67cf487ca49de646c437c217ae538

commit_message:
Add support for including Co-authored-by entries.

Some patches authorship is indicated in shared patches by Co-authored-by
entries:

http://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=451880
http://comments.gmane.org/gmane.comp.lib.gnulib.bugs/28848

Those should hit the AUTHORS file.

Change-Id: I83645dae0088ccb1ddce8f8c415693d55ff5cd04

commit_message:
Change default version object.

The version_info version object is a useful thing for consumers to
use in other places, so having it be prefixed with __ is not great.

Change-Id: I20e870ce735d79594fd23b5bda36f73f8867153c

commit_message:
Janitorial:  Catch rpc up with a change in common

Common rpc now uses jsonutils instead of json; this
patch moves that change into nova.

Change-Id: Iba45e473ae875b0973dbe6f752602b58c7980578

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 24, 'name': 'Chuck Short', 'email': 'charles.short@windriver.com', 'username': 'zulcss'}, {'_account_id': 642, 'name': 'Matt Dietz', 'email': 'matthew.dietz@gmail.com', 'username': 'cerberus'}, {'_account_id': 679, 'name': 'Kevin L.
